undertaking a project or procuring materials on city property or the property of another governmental entity in such cases by motion the city commission may decide to award a contract without the necessity of a competitive bid where the following circumstances exist a the project is in coordination with another governmental entity  b the project is on property owned by the city or owned by another governmental entity  c the other governmental entity which is participating in the project recommends a particular contractor or supplier based upon prior direct experience with that contractor or the contractor or supplier has recently provided a similar service or product or in the case of design services a design which is substantially similar to that provided to the governmental entity with whom the city is cooperating on a joint project  d the total cost of the improvements to the city is less than three million dollars $300000000  and e the city commission finds that the contract is in the best interests of the city is competitively priced and will further intergovernmental cooperation exh a 1252007  21416 4182012  exh a 372018 editors note see editors note following  21412 competitive solicitations all purchases and contractual services in excess of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 except as otherwise specified herein shall be purchased upon approval of the city commission only after a competitive bid competitive proposal or a request for qualification process is employed based upon the discretion of the purchasing director or designee a competitive bids competitive bids shall be used where the purchasing director or designee determines in hisher sole discretion that the services to be purchased are generally comparable from all sources and where price is the most significant factor in the award of the bid  contracts for most goods or construction services are typically let in this fashion the bid specifications may set forth various criteria regarding experience qualifications and other matters to ensure that the bids being considered are from bidders who are qualified to provide the products or services b request for proposals rfp request for proposals shall be used where the purchasing director or designee determines in hisher sole discretion that besides price there will be a special need to consider in greater depth the ability of the proposer to provide the goods or services or the nature of the goods or services or where there may be a need for discretion or creativity in the manner in which the goods or services are provided the purchasing director or designee may waive minor irregularities in the competitive solicitation process the request for proposals shall set forth the evaluation criteria for evaluating and ranking the responsive and responsible firms rfps shall be procured in accordance with section 2 of this c request for qualifications rfq non ccna request for qualifications shall be used where the purchasing director or designee determines in hisher sole discretion that price is not the basis for the award but the qualifications of the various proposers and their ability to perform the proposed project the request for qualifications shall set forth the standards by which the contract shall be awarded the purchasing director or designee may waive minor irregularities in the competitive solicitation process rfqs shall be procured in accordance with section 2 of this d request for information rfi request for information shall be used where the purchasing director or designee determines in hisher sole discretion that it is necessary to assess the market feasibility of a proposed project service or commodity or when vendor input to specifications or a scope of work would result in a more competitive and fair competitive solicitation process a request for information rfi may be issued requesting submission of unpriced offers products or scopes of services which may be followed by subsequent competitive solicitation that is not limited to those firms who responded to the rfi exh a 1252007   712009   4182012   3182015  exh a 372018   exemption from public records and public meeting requirements 1 responses received by the city pursuant to a competitive solicitation are exempt from the public records law fs  11907 until such time as the city provides notice of an intended decision or within thirty 30 days after opening the bids proposals or final replies whichever is earlier unless it is competitive solicitation for construction or repairs on a public building or public work in which case the responses shall be opened in compliance with fs   the name of each bidder and the price submitted in the bid shall be announced and the name of each bidder and the price submitted in the bid shall be made available upon request 2 for the purposes of this subsection proposer shall mean a person or company which responds to a request for proposals or a request for qualifications 3 any portion of a meeting at which a negotiation with a proposer is conducted pursuant to a competitive solicitation at which a proposer makes an oral presentation or answers questions as part of the competitive solicitation process shall be exempt from the sunshine law in accordance with fs   4 any portion of an evaluation committee meeting at which negotiation strategies are discussed by the evaluation committee shall be exempt from the sunshine law in accordance with fs   5 a complete recording shall be made of any portion of an exempt meeting no portion of the exempt meeting may be held off the record 6 the recording of and any records presented at the exempt meeting are exempt from the public records law fs  11907 until such time as the city provides notice of an intended decision or until thirty 30 days after opening the proposals whichever occurs earlier 7 if the city rejects all competitive solicitations and concurrently provides notice of its intent to reissue a competitive solicitation rejected bids proposals or replies remain exempt from the public records law fs  11907 until such time as the city provides notice of an intended decision concerning the reissued competitive solicitation or until the city withdraws the reissued competitive solicitation a bid proposal or reply is not exempt for longer than twelve 12 months after the initial city notice rejecting all bids proposals or replies the recording and any records presented at an exempt meeting remain exempt from the public records law fs  11907 until such time as the city provides notice of an intended decision concerning the reissued competitive solicitation or until the city withdraws the reissued competitive solicitation a recording and any records presented at an exempt meeting are not exempt for longer than twelve 12 months after the initial city notice rejecting all proposals 8 the public notice of the evaluation committee meeting shall state that the portion of the meeting at which the proposer makes a presentation or answers questions and the portion of the meeting at which the evaluation committee discusses negotiation strategies are exempt from the sunshine law in accordance with fs    5172017   cone of silence 1 prohibited communication except as set forth in subsection 4 during the course of a competitive solicitation a cone of silence shall be in effect between a any person or entity that seeks a contract contract amendment award recommendation or approval related to a competitive solicitation or that is subject to being evaluated or having its response evaluated in connection with a competitive solicitation including a person or entitys representative and b any city commissioner the city manager and their respective support staff or any person or group of persons appointed or designated by the city commission or the city manager to evaluate select or make a recommendation to the city commission or the city manager regarding a competitive solicitation 2 effective dates a cone of silence shall begin and shall end for competitive solicitations as follows a a cone of silence shall be in effect during a competitive solicitation process beginning upon the advertisement for the competitive solicitation or during such other procurement activities as declared by the city commission b the cone of silence shall terminate at the time the city commission takes final action or gives final approval of a contract rejects all bids or responses to the competitive solicitation or takes other action which ends the competitive solicitation process 3 notice when the cone of silence becomes effective for a particular competitive solicitation the city manager or designee shall provide notice of the cone of silence to the city commission the solicitation document for the goods or services shall generally disclose the requirements of this section 4 permitted communication a the cone of silence shall not apply to written or oral communications with legal counsel for the city or the purchasing and contract administration staff for the city b nothing contained in this section shall prohibit any person or entity subject to this section from 1 making public presentations at prebid conferences or at a selection or negotiation meeting related to the competitive selection 2 engaging in contract negotiations with the entity selected to negotiate the terms of the agreement or with the city commission during a public meeting 3 making a public presentation to the city commission during any public meeting related to the competitive solicitation 4 communicating with the person or persons designated in the competitive solicitation as the contact person for clarification or information related to the competitive solicitation the contact person shall not be a member of the selectionevaluation committee or the person designated to negotiate the agreement 5 communicating with the city attorney or purchasing and contract administration staff in writing as provided in subsection c below c the purchasing and contract administration division staff and the city attorney shall accept written communications from persons or entities subject to this section during the time a cone of silence is applicable to a competitive solicitation 5 violations any action in violation of this section shall be cause for disqualification of the bid or the proposal the determination of a violation and the penalty shall be made by the city commission 6 exceptions the cone of silence shall not apply to a competitive process which seeks to enter into a contract or award of money to perform governmental quasigovernmental social or human services primarily for charitable benevolent humanitarian or other philanthropic purposes such as the award of grants or support assistance to organized nonprofit entities that promote or assist with the care education health standard of living or general welfare of people in the city of parkland or that promote or assist community or neighborhood enhancements  5172017   ethics in procurement 1 any attempt by city employees to realize personal gain by conduct inconsistent with proper discharge of their duties is a breach of public trust any effort to influence any public employee to breach the standards of ethical conduct set forth in this division is also a breach of ethical standards the provisions of city ordinances county ordinances and state statutes shall be strictly enforced to preserve the public trust 2 the city shall not execute a contract if there has been a violation of this section any ethics provision of a procurement solicitation or any local state or federal law including but not limited to a conflicts of interest b kickbacks c solicitation of procurement by payment of a gratuity or offer of employment  d acceptance of a gratuity or offer of employment resulting from solicitation of procurement  e violations of the cone of silence f any other improper or unlawful attempt to influence the outcome of a procurement 3 unauthorized purchasing practices an unauthorized purchase occurs when any employee of the city orders contracts for or buys any services materials or supplies outside the purview of the city charter andor this individual making an unauthorized purchase may be subject to disciplinary actions as appropriate which may include termination andor prosecution the following are unauthorized purchasing practices a artificially dividing purchases into multiple segments in an attempt to issue single orders below the dollar threshold requirements as established herein also known as stringing or slitting purchase orders is prohibited b purchasing any supplies or services above the thresholds delineated herein directly from a vendor bypassing the purchasing and contracts and administration division c committing to a purchase without issuance of an authorized purchase order when one is required d obtaining items available on an existing city term contract from a supplier that does not hold the contract e providing false information such as false quotations without actually contacting and obtaining a quotation bid or proposal from a vendor {f} adding unauthorized purchases to previously approved purchase orders without approval of the appropriate approval authority and subsequent modification of the purchase order  5172017   criminal background checks 1 except as otherwise set forth in law for any contracts which require a contractor subcontractor consultant or subconsultant to perform work in or on city property where the contractor or any subcontractors or employees will perform work or services in close proximity to facilities with minors the elderly or persons with special needs or where the services are of a nature which would reasonably warrant background checks the city shall include a requirement for a criminal background check for any person employed by or under contract with the contractor subcontractor consultant or subconsultant who is doing the work in or on city property 2 contractors and consultants shall at their expense obtain a criminal background check as defined in subsection 1 above for each person employed by or under contract with the contractor subcontractor consultant or subconsultant having access to city property where the contractor or any subcontractors or employees will perform work or services in close proximity to facilities with minors the elderly or persons with special needs or where the services are of a nature which would reasonably warrant background checks prior to beginning the work 3 all criminal background checks must be conducted prior to any covered individuals initial access to citys property and depending on the contracts term on an annual basis thereafter the contractor or consultant shall be required to submit an affidavit on the form included with the bid documents the request for proposal or the request for qualifications certifying that background checks have been completed for all employees as set forth in subsection 2 above and certify that no employee who has been convicted or who has entered a plea of nolo contendere for any crime set forth within subsection 4 below shall perform work on city property where the contractor or any subcontractors or employees will perform work or services in close proximity to facilities with minors the elderly or persons with special needs or where the services are of a nature which would reasonably warrant background checks such affidavit shall be submitted to the contract administrator prior to any work being performed contractor or consultant shall maintain records of the criminal history checks for each person doing work on city property during the contract period and for one 1 year thereafter and shall make such records available for inspection and verification by city 4 if such a check reveals a conviction or a plea of nolo contendere regardless of when the plea or conviction occurred which includes a felony or misdemeanor involving terrorist behavior violence use of a dangerous weapon crimes of moral turpitude or breach of trustfiduciary responsibility or which raises concerns about building system or personal security or is otherwise a jobrelated crime the contractor or consultant shall not assign the individual to any work in or on city property if such a check reveals any of the foregoing after access has already been granted any access privileges already granted shall be immediately revoked and shall not be reinstated without the citys express written authorization in the event that the contractor or consultant intends to hire new personnel to perform the required services the background checks should be initiated at the time of the hire 5 the city reserves the right to approve or disapprove whether a contractors or consultants employees perform the services for the city disapproval would apply solely to the contract at issue and would have no bearing on the contractors or consultants employment of an individual outside of the contract 6} the city may conduct its own independent background checks and bar any covered individual from accessing the citys property in its complete discretion the contractors or consultants failure to comply with the terms of this provision shall be considered a material breach rendering the contractor or consultant in default and allowing immediate termination by the city 7 at the discretion of the city manager this section shall not be applicable during a declared emergency situation including but not limited to emergency cleanup of debris following a major storm 8 to the extent that work is being done on city property the criminal background check procedure shall apply to a competitive solicitation process for contractors or consultants who seek to enter into a contract or award of money to perform governmental quasigovernmental social or human services primarily for charitable benevolent humanitarian or other philanthropic purposes such as the award of grants or support assistance to organized nonprofit entities that promote or assist with the care education health standard of living or general welfare of people in the city of parkland or that promote or assist community or neighborhood enhancements  5172017 procedures   bid specifications 1 the preparation of specifications is the responsibility of the user department specifications are important and are intended to promote competition among vendors specifications should be written in terms which define the performance required or the design of the goodsservices rather than using specific brand names  provided that where there is a requirement for a specific brand such brand may be specified if the department head places a memorandum on file justifying the need for a specific brand specifications should be clear and concise and they should provide complete and detailed descriptions of the items andor servicess being solicited including quantity of items or dates of contractual services 2 if the goods or services desired is outside the expertise of the department personnel and specifications cannot be prepared by the department the department head may contact prospective bidders with a written request for information rfi and request recommended solutions to provide city staff with an adequate understanding to prepare the specifications prospective bidders and city personnel are not permitted to discuss pricing during this process 3 in addition to the specifications the bid package must contain the specific instructions and information to potential bidders the bid package must a state the time date and place where bids will be received b state statement of work instructions for preparing proposals and evaluation criteria to determine the best bidder c provide standard bid language to address public entity crimes act  compliance with laws  drug free work place  and dbe participation 4 the bidproposal package may contain such requirements as deemed appropriate and is at the sole discretion of the city exh a 1252007   712009   4182012  exh a 372018   bonding 1 bid bond the purpose of a bid bond is to protect the city against the failure or refusal of the low bidder to supply the necessary performance and payment bonds as required to proceed with performance under the contract bid bond requirements shall be at the discretion of the department head  however all construction bids over one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 must have a bid bond a a bid bond shall be provided by the bidder at the time of the bid and is submitted with the bid b the amount of the bid bond is generally expressed as a percentage of the total amount of the bid typically this is five 5 percent unless otherwise stated in the solicitation to bid c if a contractor fails to submit a bid bond with their bid the bid will be rejected d the city reserves the right to accept a certified check in lieu of a bid bond 2 performance bond payment bond and warranty bond a the purpose of bonds is to protect the city against any losses resulting from the contractors failure to meet the plans andor specifications providing labor and materials and faulty workmanship or defective materials of a contract b payment and performance bonds shall be required for projects in excess of two hundred thousand dollars $20000000 or as otherwise provided by law exh a 1252007   712009   4182012  exh a 372018   competitive bid the department head or hisher designee shall verify that funds have been appropriated and are available upon verification the purchasing director or designee shall forward the request to the city clerk for the appropriate notice to be posted or advertised in a newspaper of general circulation or the appropriate trade journal as determined necessary by the purchasing director or designee or as required by applicable law all advertisements shall provide a reasonable time of not less than fourteen 14 days for potential bidders to respond unless the department head certifies a need for purchase in a more expeditious manner in which case the fourteenday period may be reduced to seven 7 days nothing herein shall prevent the purchasing director or designee or affected department head from directly sending an invitation to bid to known potential bidders however city officers and employees shall not disclose or use any information not available to the public for personal benefit of themselves or others fs  8 exh a 1252007   4182012  exh a 372018   competitive bid opening bid openings shall be conducted in public by the purchasing director or designee at the time and place stated in the advertisement no bids will be accepted after the time and date designated bid addenda may be issued by the city up until twentyfour 24 hours before bid opening or in accordance the competitive bid specifications bids received after the time and date designated should be returned unopened this provision is not waivable a tabulation of all bids and any accompanying bid materials submitted shall be made available to the public by the purchasing director or designee exh a 1252007   4182012  exh a 372018   award of competitive bid 1 bids shall be awarded by the city commission to the lowest responsive and responsible bidder able to meet the requirements of the bid specifications in determining the lowest responsive and most responsible bidder in addition to the price the following may be considered a the ability capacity and skill of the bidder to perform the contract b whether the bidder can perform the contract within the time specified without delay or interference c the character integrity reputation judgment experience and efficiency of the bidder d the quality of performance on previous public or private contracts of a similar type e the previous and existing compliance by the bidder with laws and ordinances relating to the contract f the ability of the bidder to provide future maintenance and service g tie bids the tie may be broken and the successful vendor selected by the following criteria presented in order of importance and consideration 1 quality of the items or services if it is ascertainable 2 time of delivery if provided in the bid 3 if the criteria in subsections g1 and 2 of this section are impossible to determine with any reasonableness or do not resolve the issue the award will be given to that vendor whose bid was received first as indicated by the time stamp on the envelope containing the bid 2 bids shall be unconditionally accepted without alteration or correction except as authorized in this policy bids shall be evaluated based on the requirements set forth in the invitation for bids which may include additional criteria to determine suitability for a particular purpose 3 except where prohibited by federal state or city law for bid solicitations where the bid is to be awarded to the lowest responsive and responsible bidder without a numerical grading the city may grant a preference in the amount of five 5 percent of any bid to the lowest responsive and responsible local bidder if said local bidder is within five 5 percent of the lowest responsive and responsible bid then the lowest responsive responsible local bidder shall be permitted to match the lowest bid within three 3 business days of notice from the city for all other competitive solicitations in which evaluation factors are used to numerically evaluate the responses from vendors by the selection committee and price is one of several criteria for award among otherwise qualified vendors where a nonlocal business is the highest ranked proposer and the ranking of a local proposer is within five 5 percent of the ranking obtained by the nonlocal proposer the highest ranked local proposer within five 5 percent shall have the opportunity to proceed to negotiations with the city upon approval of such ranking by the city commission or staff if the award does not need commission approval if the purchasing director or designee is unable to negotiate a contract deemed to be acceptable with the highest ranked local proposer within five 5 percent the purchasing director or designee shall report to the city commission which shall either require that the purchasing director or designee continue negotiations or authorize negotiations with the secondranked firm whether local or nonlocal until the process is complete or until the purchasing director or designee or the city commission determines that it is no longer feasible to continue negotiating  at any time the city commission has the full discretion to either abandon the process or begin the process again 4 this section shall not apply to professional services procured pursuant to the state of florida consultants competitive negotiations act nor to cooperative purchasing plans and proposals that the city participates in with other governmental agencies or piggyback bid purchases to qualify as a local vendorbidderproposersupplier an eligible bidder or proposer must satisfy the criteria set forth in subsections 4a to c below the city has sole discretion in determining whether a business meets the criteria to qualify for a local business preference and reserves the right to revoke this preference at any time if the city determines the business no longer meets the following criteria a its principal place of business is located in the city  b the business has held a valid city business license for at least one 1 year prior to the date of application  and c it maintains its status as a local bidder throughout the term of the contract  if it fails to do so the contract shall entitle the city in its sole discretion to terminate the contract exh a 1252007   712009   5182011   4182012  exh a 372018   correction cancellation or withdrawal of bids 1 correction on bids a mathematical errors errors in extension of unit prices or mathematical calculations may be corrected by the purchasing director or designee prior to award the unit prices shall not be changed b nonjudgemental mistakes a bidder shall be permitted to correct clerical nonjudgmental mistakes of fact in their bid c voluntary reduction of price the city may accept a voluntary reduction from a low bidder after bid opening if such reduction is not conditioned on nor results in the modification or deletion of any condition contained in the invitation for bids a voluntary reduction may not be used to ascertain the lowest responsive bidder 2 cancellation of bids a any time prior to bid opening date and time the city may cancel or postpone the bid opening or cancel the invitation for bid in its entirety b after bids are open any or all bids may be rejected by the city 3 withdrawal of bids a any bidder may voluntarily withdraw or amend hisher bid at any time prior to the bid opening by providing written notice to the city amendments should be forwarded to the purchasing director or designee sealed and identified b after bid opening vendors shall not be allowed to withdraw a bid in less than ninety 90 days or a specific time period stated in the invitation to bid with the following exception the bid is so outrageous as to be a prima facie evidence of a bid mistake but a mistake that cannot be corrected by correction of mathematical computation exh a 1252007   4182012  exh a 372018   miscellaneous requirements competitive bids requests for proposals and requests for qualifications shall include the following additional provisions 1 public entity crimes in accordance with the applicable portions of fs   which reads as follows a person or affiliate who has been placed on the convicted vendor list following a conviction for a public entity crime may not submit bids on leases of real property to a public entity may not be awarded or perform work as a contractor supplier subcontractor or consultant under a contract with any public entity and may not transact business with any public entity in excess of the threshold amount provided in category two for a period of 36 months from the date of being placed on the convicted vendor list 2 noncollusive affidavit proposers shall complete the noncollusive form and shall submit the form with the proposal the failure to submit this document could result in the rejection of the proposal 3 compliance with laws the selected firm its officers agents employees and contractors shall abide by and comply with all federal state and local laws it is agreed and understood that if city calls the attention of the contractor to any such violations on the part of the contractor its officers agents employees contractors then the contractor shall immediately desist from and correct such violation if the contractor is in violation of any law the contractor shall be solely responsible for coming into compliance with such law and shall be solely responsible for the payment of any fine charged for such violation 4 drugfree workplace dfw in accordance with fs   preference shall be given to businesses with drugfree workplace programs whenever two 2 or more proposals which are equal with respect to price quality and service are received by the city for the procurement of commodities or contractual services a proposal received from a business that completes the attached dfw form certifying that it is a dfw shall be given preference in the award process 5 disadvantaged business enterprises dbe participation offerors are advised that the city promotes equal employment opportunity eeo and encourages the participation of minority and women business enterprises mwbe as well as small business enterprises sbe in all aspects of contracting joint venturing at the prime and subconsultant levels is encouraged where the joint venture results in a more qualified andor more diverse proposer proposers shall make efforts to maintain no less than fifteen 15 percent dbe participation for contracts over one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 the city will accept certifications from offerors including their subcontractors identified in their response as defined and certified by the florida department of management office of supplier diversity or other certifying organizations or jurisdictions in accordance with fs  1 and 2 6 multiple contracts prohibited the use of multiple contracts may not be employed in order to avoid compliance with the competitive procedures set forth in sections 21412  exh a 1252007   712009   4182012  exh a 372018   capital outlay expenditures 1 notwithstanding any other requirements exceptions exemptions or limitations on purchases each item purchased within the capital outlay expenditure category including but not limited to land buildings improvements other than buildings and machinery and equipment shall require the use of a purchase order 2 a fixed asset is a durable item with a longterm nature of use a normal expected life of one 1 year or more and a value of one thousand dollars $100000 or more at the time of acquisition fixed assets include items of real and tangible personal property of a nonconsumable nature of the city exh a 1252007  21438 4182012 request for proposals rfp 1 when the purchasing director or designee determines that the use of competitive sealed bidding is either not practicable or not advantageous to the city a contract may be made by use of a request for proposals proposals to be sealed shall be solicited request for proposals public notice of the request for proposals shall be given in the same manner as provided herein relating to an invitation for bids 2 sealed proposals shall be opened at the time designated in the public notice of the request for proposals a list of proposals shall be prepared containing the name of each vendor the number of modifications received if any and a description sufficient to identify the proposal offered 3 the request for proposals shall state the relative importance of price and other evaluation factors 4 as provided in the request for proposals discussions may be conducted with responsible vendors who intended to submit proposals for the purpose of clarification to assure full understanding of and conformance to the request for proposals vendors shall be accorded fair and equal treatment with respect to opportunities for discussion and revision of proposals revisions may be permitted after submission and prior to award in the discretion of the city for the purpose of obtaining best and final offers 5 award shall be made to the responsible vendor whose proposal is determined to be the most advantageous to the city taking into consideration price and the evaluation factors set forth in the request for proposals 6 the city may reject all proposals in its sole discretion for any reason and the request for proposals shall so state 7 the process for making a selection pursuant to the request for proposal shall be as follows a the purchasing director or designee shall appoint a selection evaluation committee having a minimum of three 3 members all meetings of the selection committee shall be conducted in a manner consistent with the sunshine law and all applicants shall receive notice by either mail fax or email a quorum shall be a majority of members except that if there are only three 3 members all three 3 must be present to participate the members of the selection committee must be physically present all members shall be free of any conflicts of interest as set forth in fs ch 112 the selection committee shall then set forth the procedure for reviewing the applicants the selection committee shall reduce the number of firms to a short list of a minimum of three 3 provided at least three 3 firms applied in shortlisting firms the committee shall use the criteria set forth in the rfp and attempt to select the best qualified firms for the particular project based upon the evaluation criteria the committee may hold discussions with all shortlisted firms  however said discussions are not mandatory b the firms shall be ranked in order of preference this ranking and a report of the committees analysis shall be provided to the city commission the city commission by majority vote has the option to either 1 approve the evaluation committees ranking and recommendation  2 recommend rejection of all submittals based upon a stated reason  or 3 send the ranking back to the evaluation committee to conduct further evaluations consistent with the requirements of the rfp and the evaluation committee may either ratify the ranking or rerank the firms additionally the city commission reserves the right to rerank in accordance with section 214310 c upon the city commission approving a ranking the commission may authorize the purchasing director or designee to negotiate a contract with the topranked firm if the purchasing director or designee is unable to negotiate a contract deemed to be acceptable with the top ranked firm the purchasing director or designee shall report to the city commission which shall either require that the purchasing director or designee continue negotiations or authorize negotiations with the secondranked firm until the process is complete or until the purchasing director or designee or the city commission determines that it is no longer feasible to continue negotiating  at any time the city commission has the full discretion to either abandon the process or begin the process again  4182012   3182015  exh a 372018 request for qualifications rfq non ccna 1 the purchasing director or designee with the recommendation of the department head in charge of the construction project shall make a determination as to whether the construction project should be bid using the twostep prequalification process if such a determination is made the prequalification of bidders shall occur as follows a the city shall develop a request for qualifications rfq describing the project to be bid and indicating that only bidders who are prequalified may bid on the project the rfq shall be advertised in the same manner as a request for proposals b the rfq shall require statements of the background and experience of companies and their principals president vice president and shareholders holding more than thirty 30 percent of the shares who are going to submit bids  and c potential bidders shall be required to delineate experience on past projects of a similar scope size and building type  and d potential bidders shall be required to give at least three 3 references related to similar construction projects undertaken within the past three 3 years of a similar size and scope to that being bid  and e potential bidders and their principals president vice president and shareholders holding more than thirty 30 percent of the shares indicate any litigation in which it has been involved related to provision of construction services or the payment for contractual services during the past five 5 years the style of the case and the case number shall be provided as well as the status and any documentation of any final judgments or verdicts  and f requests for information relative to financial resources and credit worthiness of the potential bidder and qualifier including bonding information and limits as deemed appropriate by the city to assure sufficient financial resources and credit worthiness of the potential bidder may be made  and g any other information deemed relevant by the city for prequalification shall be placed in the bid specifications 2 the purchasing director or designee shall appoint an evaluation committee of at least three 3 members which shall examine the responses for the sole purpose of determining whether the potential bidders have the experience expertise financial and physical resources and responsibility to satisfactorily and timely complete the project the committee may appoint a representative or representatives to contact all references listed and other persons involved in projects listed by the potential bidder as well as any other person who is deemed to have relevant information as a result of such inquiries 3 thereafter the evaluation committee at a publically advertised evaluation meeting shall list those potential bidders which it deems qualified by experience expertise financial and physical resources and responsibility to satisfactorily and timely complete the project upon approval of the prequalified list of bidders by the city commission the commission may authorize the purchasing director or designee to issue an invitation to bid to the prequalified bidders only those bidders who have been so prequalified may then bid on the project the purchasing director or designee shall then provide bid packets for bidding the project to prequalified bidders who shall be permitted to bid on the project per the terms of the bid packet the city commission shall award the bid to the prequalified bidder who submits the lowest responsive responsible bid  192013  exh a 372018 construction manager at risk process 1 the city commission may determine that it is in the best interest of the city to provide an alternate procedure for hiring a contractor for a construction contract in the city of parkland the procedures as set forth herein are available for construction contracts in excess of one million dollars $100000000 where the city commission makes a motion determining that the process herein known as construction manager at risk would be in the public interest the construction manager at risk approach shall provide for a process requiring the contractor to work with the city to provide a guaranteed maximum price and completion date and to implement the project to meet that requirement upon making such a motion the construction contract shall be let as provided herein and in a manner compliant with fs   2 upon making the motion as set forth above the city commission may award a contract for construction process of negotiation with proposers based upon responses to a request for qualifications the request for qualifications shall state the nature of the process the desire for the city to retain a construction manager who shall manage the construction project and assure completion within budget and timeline and request the qualifications of the various proposers the request for qualifications shall list the minimum information required in the proposal which shall include references and experience on past projects of similar scope size and building type previous experience with construction manager at risk projects information relative to financial resources and other information deemed relevant by the purchasing director or designee the proposal shall be reviewed by a committee appointed by the purchasing director or designee which committee may determine in its sole discretion if interviews with proposers are necessary after the evaluation committee reviews the proposals a recommendation shall be made to the city commission based upon the evaluation committees determination as to which proposal would be in the best interests of the city of parkland which would be the most likely to assure completion of the project on time and within budget and which would be able to provide a high quality of construction 3 upon the city commission approving a ranking the commission may authorize the purchasing director or designee to negotiate a contract with the topranked firm if the purchasing director or designee is unable to negotiate a contract deemed to be acceptable with the top ranked firm the purchasing director or designee shall report to the city commission which shall either require that the purchasing director or designee continue negotiations or authorize negotiations with the secondranked firm until the process is complete or until the purchasing director or designee or the city commission determines that it is no longer feasible to continue negotiating  at any time the city commission has the full discretion to either abandon the process or begin the process again  192013   3182015  exh a 372018 exemption from public records and public meeting requirements 1 from the public records law fs  11907 until such time as the city provides notice of an intended decision concerning the reissued competitive solicitation or until the city withdraws the reissued competitive solicitation a bid proposal or reply is not exempt for longer than twelve 12 months after the initial city notice rejecting all bids proposals or replies the recording and any records the portion of the meeting at which the evaluation committee discusses negotiation strategies are exempt from the sunshine law in accordance with fs   exh a 372018 change orders the city commission reviews and approves all change orders for payment all changes orders are processed either as a callup item if they are minor in nature as determined by the criteria outlined below or action by the city commission hearing process all change orders are initially reviewed by the assigned construction administrator or appropriate city official once a change order is deemed fair and reasonable by the appropriate city official the change order shall be processed as follows 1 change orders that may be approved by city commission as a callup item the following are the criteria for change orders that are deemed minor in nature and may be processed as a callup item a when added to the original contract amount and all prior change orders do not exceed the amount of the approved project contingency  b the change order does not substantially change the scope of the project  and c the total increase in the contract amount as a result of the change order does not exceed the lesser of ten 10 percent of the total contract amount or two hundred fifty dollars $ if the appropriate city official determines that the above criteria are met then the change order shall be processed as follows a the purchasing director or designee shall forward a copy of the change order and a brief memorandum prepared by the city official to each city commissioner the memorandum shall summarize the change order relative to the criteria above b each city commissioner shall have five 5 business days starting on the date the purchasing director or designee distributes the change order and memorandum to review and provide a written response to the purchasing director or designee stating whether he or she wishes the change order be scheduled for public hearing c if any commissioner responds within the allocated timeframe in b above that he or she wishes to consider the application at a public hearing of the city commission ie call up the change order the city official shall automatically advertise and schedule the change order item for public hearing before the city commission to take place within fortyfive 45 days of the commissioner callup request absent such a request from any of the city commissioners within the allocated timeframe the change order shall be approved without the requirement of a public hearing 2 change orders that require city commission approval hearing process change orders that do not meet the criteria in subsections 1ac above shall require city commission approval prior to processing payment to obtain city commission approval the following steps are required a the appropriate city official will coordinate all the required documents for approval by the city commission with the construction administrator if applicable b the change orders and all applicable supporting documentation will be scheduled for approval at the next available city commission meeting c upon approval appropriate city official shall process payment of change orders as stipulated by the payment procedures outlined in the contract documents in the case of emergency situations as defined in the emergency purchasespecial circumstances ordinances section 2144 exception may be made and payments may be processed according to section 2144 all owner directed change orders shall require purchasing director or designee review and approval  242014  exh a 372018 procedures set forth in sections 21412 shall not apply for emergency purchases or where there are special circumstances as set forth herein an emergency purchase shall be a purchase during an emergency declared by the governor by the mayor of the county or the mayor of the city additionally an emergency purchase shall be a purchase made to avert an imminent danger to life safety health andor property or breakdown of equipment that may cause serious determent of services to residents and where following the procedures set forth in sections 21412 would cause harm to persons or property a special circumstance shall include a purchase where there is a lack of available bidders or vendors solesource contracts or other circumstances not caused by the city which make it contrary to the public interests to comply with the requirements of sections 21412  where the city commission awards such a contract the basis for the exception shall be set forth in a resolution where the purchasing director or designee finds that there is an emergency or that there are special circumstances the purchasing director or designee may approve a contract to purchase materials or services up to an amount of fifty thousand dollars $5000000 for purchases over twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 the purchasing director or designee shall provide notice to the city commission of the purchase state the basis for the emergency or the special circumstances and place the notice on record at the next regular city commission meeting no contract lasting more than ninety 90 days may be executed pursuant to the authority granted by this section unless ratified by the city commission prior to the conclusion of the ninety 90 days exh a 1252007   712009   4182012  exh a 372018   waiver of procurement requirements the city commission may waive the procurement requirements set forth in sections 2141 in such cases the commission finds that it is in the best interests of the city to do so and that the waiver of competitive bid requirements will not inure to the financial disadvantage of the city in no case may competitive bidding requirements be waived where said waiver would constitute a violation of state law  5182011 bid protests where a bidder who submits a bid pursuant to sections 21412 believes that the city has violated any provision of sections 21412 said bidder shall submit written notice to the purchasing director or designee within three 3 business days of the subject incident said notice shall be labeled as a bid protest and shall contain the basis for the protest including but not limited to a description of the sections of the the circumstances which constitute the violation upon receipt of a timely filed notice the purchasing director or designee shall schedule a hearing before the city commission for a determination on the bid protest the purchasing director or designee shall provide notice of the hearing to the person filing the protest and to any other bidder who has submitted a bid the city commission determination on the bid protest shall be final no bid protest may be filed subsequent to the award of a bid by the city commission as a condition of any bid protest the protestor shall present the city with a nonrefundable filing fee payable in accordance with the schedule provided as follows estimated contract amount filing fee five hundred dollars $250000 the city may accept cash money order certified check or cashiers check payable to the city of parkland if upon receipt of the bid protest the purchasing director or following procedures shall apply where the city procures services regulated by fs   referred to as consultants competitive negotiations act ccna 1 the following procedures apply for existing contracts where the city has undertaken a selection process in conformity with the ccna for specific services regulated by the ccna and more than one 1 firm has been retained to provide said continuing services pursuant to a continuing services contract a city staff should review the qualifications of approved contractors to determine which firm best meets the needs of the project and should attempt to equitably distribute the work to the various contractors retained b city staff shall provide documentation as to the basis for utilizing the particular contractor together with a justification as to why the particular contractor was selected and file with the city clerk c the chosen firm shall provide a complete task authorization or work authorization which describes the scope of the project the services to be provided and a detailed breakdown of the consideration together with a total cost estimate with expenses if possible the purchasing director or designee may negotiate with the consultant as to the terms of the work authorization and may decide upon another approved consultant working under a continuing services contract if the terms of the work authorization are deemed noncompetitive or not in the best interests of the city by the purchasing director or designee d if the value of the work exceeds twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 the city commission must approve the work authorization e the value of the project may not exceed two million dollars $200000000 and the value of the services may not exceed two hundred thousand dollars $20000000 unless the specific project was specifically referenced in the rfq which led to the award of the continuing services contract with the firm f no continuing services contract entered into after  shall exceed three 3 years 2 the following procedures shall comply with the ccna procedures for obtaining a new consultant covered by the act a the purchasing director or designee shall issue an rfq to obtain qualifications from potential consultants from which the selection will be made b an evaluation committee comprised of staff as appointed by the purchasing director or designee shall be established  the purchasing director or designee shall appoint at least one 1 member from the using agency or department and others who have expertise which will assist them in the necessary evaluation c the committee shall have a minimum of three 3 members all meetings of the selection committee shall be conducted in a manner consistent with the sunshine law and all applicants shall receive notice by either mail fax or email a quorum shall be a majority of members except that if there are only three 3 members all three 3 must be present to participate the members of the selection committee must be physically present all members shall be free of any conflicts of interest as set forth in fs ch 112 the selection committee shall then set forth the procedure for reviewing the applicants the selection committee shall reduce the number of firms to a short list of a minimum of three 3 provided at least three 3 firms applied in shortlisting firms the committee shall use the criteria set forth in the rfq and attempt to select the best qualified firms for the particular project the committee shall then hold discussions with all shortlisted firms this may be undertaken at the same meeting or a meeting scheduled by the committee d after discussions are held with the shortlisted firms the voting members of the selection committee may discuss the presentations and the qualifications of each firm further and shall rank the firms based upon which firms at least will best serve the city based upon the factors set forth in the rfq the firms shall be ranked in order of preference this ranking and a report of the committees analysis shall be provided to the city commission the city commission by majority vote has the option to either 1 approve the evaluation committees ranking and recommendation  2 recommend rejection of all submittals based upon a stated reason  or 3 send the ranking back to the evaluation committee to conduct further evaluations consistent with the requirements of the rfp and the evaluation committee may either ratify the ranking or rerank the firms the city commission reserves the right to rerank in accordance with section 214310 e upon the city commission approving a ranking the commission may authorize the purchasing director or designee to negotiate a contract with the topranked firm if the purchasing director or designee is unable to negotiate a contract deemed to be acceptable with the top ranked firm the purchasing director or designee shall report to the city commission which shall either require that the purchasing director or designee continue negotiations or authorize negotiations with the secondranked firm until the process is complete or until the purchasing director or designee or the city commission determines that it is no longer feasible to continue negotiating  at any time the city commission has the full discretion to either abandon the process or begin the process again f all procedures set forth in subsections 2a f of this section shall be applied in a manner consistent with the ccna and in compliance therewith 3 contract administration the purchasing director or designee shall appoint a contract administrator or project manager for each contract to assure compliance with the contract and applicable law the contract administrator or project manager shall review and approve all pay requests or deny same as required  472010 such organizations as the small business administration and the minority business development agency of the department of commerce  5172017 article viii  interim services and facilities fee applicable to structures footnotes  15  editors note pursuant to instructions by the city  adopted jan 3 199 has been codified herein as art viii  21472151 cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 4  taxation and finance ch 19 definitions for the purposes of this article the terms used herein are defined as follows application of interim services and facilities fee as of the date a certificate of occupancy is issued by the city every structure located within the city shall be subject to an interim services and facilities fee this interim services and facilities fee shall be in effect until that date when the structure in question appears on the assessment rolls of the tax assessors office in broward county florida owner that person or legal entity reflected on the public records of broward county florida as the owner of real property upon which a structure has been completed structure any building constructed upon real property located within the municipal boundaries of the city which is not exempt from municipal ad valorem taxation as provided by general law  131990 minimum fee notwithstanding the fee calculation provided herein the minimum interim services and facilities fee shall be ten dollars $1000  131990 method of computation an interim services and facilities fee applicable to structures certified for occupancy by the city building department but not appearing on the broward county florida tax rolls as an improvement to real property shall be computed annually by the city finance department according to the following criteria 1 the interim services and facilities fee shall be computed at the rate of onehalf 12 percent per annum of the certified cost of construction of the structures but in no event shall the certified cost be less than the value of the structure as stated in the building permit 2 the interim services and facilities fee shall then be prorated on a per diem basis for the days following the issuance of any certificate of occupancy and continue until the beginning of the administrative tax year beginning on january 1 of the succeeding calendar year 3 the interim services and facilities fee shall be levied for municipal services rendered to those properties not exempt from ad valorem taxation and issued a certificate of occupancy either permanent or temporary for a full or a partial use of the premises which have not received a tax bill  131990 procedure for collection the chief building official of the city shall be charged with the collection of the interim services and facilities fee which fee shall be collected as a condition precedent to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy by the building department upon request for a certificate of occupancy the chief building official shall request and shall receive a statement of the interim services and facilities fee due and payable for the structure in question from the finance department of the city said fee shall be presented to the owner of the property and collected prior to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy subsequent to collection and in any event on a daily basis the chief building official shall remit monies collected pursuant to this section to the finance department all fees collected shall be used to provide public services which benefit those who pay the fee  131990 lien for unpaid interim services and facilities fee a lien for all interim services and facilities fees shall attach to any property as of the date of the issuance of the certificate of occupancy by the building department and shall continue in full force and effect until discharged by payment as provided within this article such liens shall be foreclosed as provided by law  131990 sale purchase or exchange of real property the city may purchase sell or exchange real property without competitive bids and subject to any provisions of the city charter for any sale or purchase of real property with an estimated value between one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 and five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 the city shall secure one 1 appraisal where the value is estimated to be in excess of five hundred thousand dollars $50000000 two 2 appraisals shall be obtained where there is an exchange of properties the necessary appraisals shall be conducted on each property no contract for sale purchase or exchange of real property shall be executed by the city until such time as the city has adopted an ordinance which states the general terms of the transaction and incorporates the contract for purchase sale or exchange the ordinance shall require the affirmative vote of four 4 members of the city commission to be effective  5201992 secs 21532160  reserved article ix  personnel rules and regulations footnotes  16  editors note pursuant to of the city commission  271990   3182009 secs 21622190  reserved article x  pensions division 1  generally secs 21912220  reserved division 2  police pension plan and trust fund retirement plan established  name  operative date  minimum benefits a a retirement plan is hereby established and placed under the exclusive administration and management of a board of trustees for the purpose of providing retirement benefits pursuant to the provisions of this division and for defraying the reasonable expenses of the retirement plan b the retirement plan established by this article shall be known as the city of parkland police officers retirement plan c the retirement plan shall have an effective date of  d the plan shall provide not less than the minimum level of benefits required by florida statutes  382004   8182004 definitions the following words and phrases as used in this division shall have the following meanings accumulated contributions shall mean the sum of all amounts deducted from a members compensation or picked up on behalf of a member active membership shall mean membership in the retirement plan as an employee actuarial equivalent shall mean that any benefit payable under the terms of this system other than the normal form of benefit shall have the same actuarial present value on the date the payment commences as the normal form of benefit for purposes of establishing the actuarial present value of any form of benefit other than a lump sum distribution all future payments shall be discounted for interest at the rate of seven 7 percent and mortality using the 1983 group annuity mortality table in the case of a lump sum distribution the actuarial present value shall be determined on the basis of the same interest and mortality rates as set forth in this section and shall have a conjunctive meaning beneficiary shall mean any person receiving a retirement allowance or other benefit from the retirement plan benefit shall mean a retirement allowance or other payment provided by the retirement plan board or board of trustees shall mean the board of trustees of the retirement plan city shall mean the city of parkland florida for the purposes of this plan the term city shall also include the broward county sheriffs office credited service shall mean membership credit upon which a members eligibility to receive benefits under the retirement plan is based and upon which the amount of such benefits is to be determined disability shall mean the permanent and total incapacity to perform regular and continuous duties as a police officer for the city of parkland or as a broward county deputy sheriff the term regular and continuous as used in this definition shall not require that a police officer be able to perform all of the duties set forth in the job description but shall mean the ability to perform work within the classification of police officer for which a position has been made available by the city consistent with the physical or mental health of the member early service retirement shall mean a members withdrawal from service under circumstances permitting the payment of a retirement benefit before such member is eligible for normal service retirement early service retirement shall be permitted upon the attainment of age fifty 50 with ten 10 years of credited service earnable compensation shall mean a members total cash remuneration for services rendered  and shall exclude payments for extra duty or special  detail work performed on behalf of a second party overtime included in this definition shall not exceed three hundred 300 hours for any person who first became a plan member on or after  compensation for any plan year shall not include any amounts in excess of the internal revenue a17 limitation as amended and shall be further adjusted for change in the cost of living in the manner prescribed by the irc section 401a17b for any person who first became a member prior to the first plan year beginning on or after  the limitation on compensation shall be not less than the maximum amount which was allowed to be taken into account under the plan as in effect on  which limitation shall be adjusted for changes in the cost of living since 1989 in the manner provided by irc section 401a171991 notwithstanding the foregoing the board may include any covered compensation to the extent permitted by the law in effect in the year in which the income was earned employee shall mean a police officer presently employed by the city or as a broward county deputy sheriff who elected membership in this plan at the date of adoption of the plan a police officer who is reclassified due to disability as a city employee outside of the police service shall have membership rights in the retirement plan applicable to that new class of employees final monthly compensation shall mean a members average monthly rate of earnable compensation from the city during the five 5 best years out of the last ten 10 years of employment  provided that if a member has been employed for fewer than five 5 years such average shall be taken over the period of actual employment fund shall mean the city of parkland police officers retirement plan may shall mean a permissive term member shall mean a police officer actively employed by the city or as a broward county deputy sheriff for whom contributions to the retirement plan are made as required by this division who elected membership in the plan at the date of adoption members shall also include retired police officers and deputy sheriffs option shall mean one 1 of several choices available to members with respect to the manner in which a retirement allowance may be paid pension shall mean a series of periodic payments usually for life payable in monthly installments police officer shall mean any person for whom contributions to the retirement plan as required by this division who is certified as a police officer as a condition of employment in accordance with the provisions of fs   and who is vested with the authority to bear arms and make arrests and whose primary responsibility is the prevention and detection of crime or the enforcement of the penal criminal traffic or highway laws of the state including supervisory and managerial personnel for the purposes of this plan the term police officer shall include broward county deputy sheriffs pickup amounts shall mean employer contributions derived from a members earnable compensation reduction in the members earnable compensation as permitted by section 414h2 of the internal revenue year shall mean the period form october 1 of the following year retirement shall mean a members withdrawal from active membership with a benefit granted to the member pursuant to the provisions of this division retirement allowance shall mean a pension provided by the retirement plan retirement plan shall mean the city of parkland police officers retirement plan service shall mean active service as an employee service retirement shall mean a members retirement from active service under circumstances permitting payment of a retirement allowance without reduction because of age or length of service and without special qualifications such as disability service retirement shall be considered normal retirement trustee shall mean a member of the board of trustees of the retirement plan vested benefit shall mean an immediate or deferred benefit to which a member has gained a nonforfeitable right under the provisions of this division vesting shall mean ten 10 years of credited service before the member is entitled to retirement benefits except for serviceincurred disability retirement income or service incurred death benefits for the purposes of this plan vesting service shall commence with the initial date of employment with the city  382004   10202004   1242013 administration of the retirement plan a the sole and exclusive administration of and the responsibility for proper operation of the retirement plan and for making effective the provisions of this division is vested in a board of trustees b the board of trustees shall consist of five 5 persons  two 2 of whom shall be legal residents of the city and who shall be appointed by the city commission the city appointees may be members of the city commission as service on the board is deemed an additional duty of the office of city commissioner two 2 members of the board of trustees shall be police officers elected by a majority of the police officers who are active members of the plan a fifth member of the board shall be chosen by a majority of the other four 4 trustees and such persons name shall be submitted to the city commission for appointment the city commission shall appoint the fifth member selected by the other four 4 trustees as a ministerial duty should no active police officer members be available to serve on the board of trustees retired members of the plan may serve on the board if so elected by membership if there are no active or retired police officers remaining in the plan or capable of serving the remaining board members may elect an individual to serve in the active police officer member seat upon receipt of such persons name the city commission shall as a ministerial duty appoint such person to the board c all trustees shall serve a term of four 4 years if a vacancy shall occur prior to the expiration of a members term a replacement member shall be chosen in the same manner as the person who has left office a replacement trustee shall serve a full term measured from the date of replacement all trustees shall serve until their replacements are selected a trustee who misses two 2 consecutive meetings without an excuse satisfactory to the board shall be subject to removal for neglect of duty as permitted by fs   d the board of trustees shall prescribe a uniform election procedure for the selection of the active member trustees e all trustees shall serve without compensation but they shall be reimbursed from the fund for all necessary expenses authorized by the board the board shall be permitted to prescribe uniform rules for reimbursement for travel expenditures f the board of trustees shall annually select a chairman and a secretary who shall execute all documents on behalf of the board g a majority of the members of the board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business and shall have full power to act under the terms of the plan three 3 concurring votes shall be required of the board to take action h the board shall keep minutes of all meetings and a record of any action taken by the board shall be kept in written form and maintained by the board i the board of trustees shall have the authority to make such uniform rules and regulations and to take such action as may be necessary to carry out the provisions of the plan and all decisions of the board of trustees made in good faith shall be final binding and conclusive on all parties j the board of trustees shall be deemed the named fiduciary of the plan and shall discharge its responsibilities solely in the interest of the members and beneficiaries of the plan for the exclusive purpose of providing benefits to the members and their beneficiaries and to defray the reasonable expenses of the plan the trustees shall exercise those fiduciary responsibilities with the care skill prudence and diligence under the circumstances then prevailing that a prudent person acting in a like capacity and familiar with such matters would use in the conduct of an enterprise of a similar character and with similar aims k the board of trustees shall have the following administrative duties 1 to maintain such records as are necessary for calculating and distributing retirement benefits  2 to maintain such records as are necessary for financial accounting and reporting of retirement plan funds  3 to maintain such records as are necessary for actuarial evaluation of the retirement plan including investigations into the mortality service and compensation experience of its members and beneficiaries  4 to compile such other administrative or investment information as is necessary for the management of the retirement plan  5 to process certify andor respond to all correspondence bills and statements received by the retirement plan as well as all applications submitted to the board for retirement benefits  6 to establish and maintain communication with city departments and other agencies of government as is necessary for the management of the retirement plan including preparing filing and distributing such reports and information as are required by law to be prepared filed or distributed on behalf of the retirement plan  7 to determine all questions relating to and process all applications for eligibility participation and benefits  8 to distribute at regular intervals to employees a comprehensive summary plan description and periodic reports regarding the financial and actuarial status of the plan  9 to retain and compensate such professional and technical experience as is necessary to fulfill its fiduciary responsibilities  10 to make recommendations regarding changes in the provisions of the plan  11 to assure the prompt deposit of all member contributions city contributions fs monies and investment earnings  12 to establish a uniform set of rules and regulations for the management of the trust  13 to take such other action as the trustees shall deem in their sole and exclusive discretion as being necessary for the efficient management of the plan l the board shall have the authority to retain its own legal counsel accountants actuaries and other professional advisors to assist the board in the performance of its duties the board may act without independent investigation upon the professional advice of the advisors so retained m the board is authorized to prosecute or defend actions claims or proceedings of any nature or kind for the protection of the fund assets or for the protection of the board in the performance of its duties n neither the board nor any of its individual members shall have any personal liability for any action taken in good faith the trustees individually and the board as a whole shall be entitled to the protections in fla stat the trustees shall also be authorized to purchase from the assets of the fund errors and omission insurance to protect the trustees in the performance of their duties such insurance shall not provide protection against a trustees fraud intentional misrepresentation willful misconduct or gross negligence o no trustee shall be responsible at his or her own expense to take legal action to correct the misconduct of any other member of the board of trustees a trustee shall have an affirmative obligation however to publicly reveal any misfeasance malfeasance or nonfeasance by a cotrustee and upon making such revelation in a public meeting shall be relieved further individual responsibility of the actions of that cotrustee  382004   8182004   472010 contributions a the city shall pick up rather than deduct from each members pay beginning with the date of employment five 5 percent of the members earnable compensation this pickup shall be intended to permit the favorable tax treatment of the employee contribution as permitted by section 414h2 of the internal revenue providing that the employee contribution shall be directly transmitted to the plan by the city by reducing the employees compensation prior to the determination of taxable income the monies so pickedup shall be deposited in the fund immediately after each pay period an account record shall be maintained continuously for each member pickup contributions shall continue until death disability or termination of service whichever shall occur first contributions shall remain in the fund unless withdrawn as provided in the plan no member shall have the option to choose to receive the contributed amounts directly instead of having them paid by the city directly to the plan all such pickup contributions by the city shall be deemed and be considered as part of the members accumulated contributions and subject to all provisions of the plan pertaining to accumulated contributions of members the intent of this provision is to comply with section 414h2 of the internal revenue the purpose of accruing and calculating pension benefits social security benefits overtime compensation percentage increases to base pay supplemental percentage payments for particular assignments education experience longevity years of service payroll steps licensure or training and for paying social security taxes and for such other purposes except as specified in this plan the amount of employee contributions pickedup or paid by the city will be added to the amount distributed on a current basis in order to determine total wages salary pay or compensation b all benefits payable under this plan are in lieu of a refund of accumulated contributions in any event however each member shall be guaranteed the payment of benefits at least equal in total amount to the members accumulated contributions c any monies received or receivable by reason of the laws of the state of florida for the express purpose of funding or paying for retirement benefits for police officers shall be deposited into the fund within five 5 business days of receipt by the city state monies shall be used to provide extra benefits to police officers over and above those provided to general employees of the city d the city shall make such contribution under the florida protection of public employee retirement benefits act and florida statutes which together with contributions pickedup on behalf of members plan earnings and state insurance premium tax rebates will maintain the fund on a sound actuarial basis as determined by the board in
