to prevent the entry of young children 3 for the purpose of this subsection a person is lawfully upon private property when he is on such property in the performance of any duty imposed upon him by the laws of this state or by the laws of the postal regulations of the united states or when he is on such property upon invitation expressed or implied of the owner thereof b restrictions 1 it shall be unlawful for the owner of a vicious dog to permit the dog to be outside a proper enclosure unless the dog is muzzled to the extent that the dog is not harmed or rendered unable to breathe or see but is prevented from biting another person or domestic or agricultural animal and restrained on a chain or leash not exceeding six 6 feet in length and under the control of a competent person 2 it shall be unlawful to maintain or keep any dog within the city limits which has twice bitten or attacked any person domestic animal or agricultural animal where such attack occurred off the property of the owner or person with custody thereof upon receipt of the second dog bite report by the city involving the same dog the dog shall be declared a public nuisance and the code enforcement officer shall immediately commence proceedings against the owner of the dog seeking an order from the code enforcement special magistrate to have the dog permanently removed from the city limits  in the alternative the city may initiate a municipal prosecution in the county court for any violation of this section the city may also seek injunctive relief in the circuit court to secure removal of the dog 3 this section does not apply to dogs used by law enforcement officials for law enforcement work c penalty any violation of this section shall be punishable by a five hundred dollar $50000 fine each incident or day the violation occurs shall be deemed a separate violation  4261995   1152008 secs 36310  reserved article ii  dogs division 1  generally secs 312322  reserved division 2  rabies vaccination required a no person shall own keep maintain nor harbor any dog over the age of six 6 months within the city without such dog having been vaccinated for rabies at least within the past twelve 12 months b every keeper shall exhibit proof of such vaccination upon demand of any police officer of the city  secs 324334  reserved division 3  running at large prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person who shall own or be in control of or be in custody of any dog to permit such dog to run at large without the restraint of a leash controlled by the person in custody of the dog within the corporate limits of the city  provided that this shall not prohibit a dog from running at large on property of the owner or person in control of or in custody of the dog    7181984   551993 vicious dogsunlawful for owner to permit to run at large it shall be unlawful for the owner of any vicious dog as defined herein to permit either willfully or to exercise due care of control any such vicious dog to run at large within the city  191979 penalties any person who violates the provisions of section 335 andor 336 shall after conviction by a court of competent jurisdiction be liable for a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisonment of not more than ninety 90 days or both in the discretion of the county judge  7181984 supervision and confinement  tethering a the following terms as used in this section are defined as set out below animal a multicellular organism of the kingdom animalia differing from plants in certain typical characteristics such as capacity for locomotion nonphotosynthetic metabolism pronounced response to stimuli restricted growth and fixed bodily structure tether the act of constraining an animals movement by securing a leash or other similar device which is holding a dog to some object which is attached to the ground b any person who owns or any person who is in charge of any dog cat or animal kept as a pet is prohibited from confining or tethering that dog cat or animal outdoors during periods of extreme weather or when a hurricane warning has been issued c any person who owns or any person who is in charge of any dog cat or animal kept as a pet who confines that animal outdoors on private property must provide the dog cat or animal with 1 sufficient and appropriate food and potable water  and 2 adequate shelter from cold heat sun and rain  and 3 periodic supervision which shall mean that each animal shall be attended to at least once during every twelve 12 consecutive hours  and 4 adequate space for exercise which shall mean no less than one hundred fifty 150 square feet per animal  and 5 a fenced yard an electronic fence or an enclosure which has at least one 1 translucent side that is sufficient to prevent the animal from escaping  or 6 a tether under the following circumstances a any person who owns or any person who is in charge or in control of any dog cat or animal that is under the age of six 6 months shall not tie chain or otherwise tether a dog cat or animal kept as a pet that is under the age of six 6 months outdoors b any person who owns or any person who is in charge or in control of any animal that is over the age of six 6 months shall not tie chain or otherwise tether a dog cat or animal kept as a pet outdoors between the hours of  am and  pm except that an animal kept as a pet of any age may be temporarily tethered tied or chained outdoors for a total time period not exceeding fifteen 15 minutes at other times it is permitted to tie chain or otherwise tether an animal kept as a pet that is over the age of six 6 months outdoors if the pet is collared by a properly fitting nonchoke type collar or a body harness that is fastened to either i a tether that is at least three 3 times the body length of the dog cat or animal measured from the dog cat or animals nose to back of the hindquarters and that is free from entanglement  or ii an overhead run which is a leash or chain attached to an overhead wire at least ten 10 feet long that allows the dog cat or animal to move unheeded when total weight of the collar together with the chain rope or tether does not exceed onesixteenth  116  the body weight of the animal d nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit an owner or keeper from controlling a dog cat or animal kept as a pet by the handheld use of a rope leash or chain when total weight of the collar together with the chain rope or tether does not exceed onesixteenth  116  of the body weight of the animal  352008 secs 339347  reserved division 4  impounding authority  disposition a if a police officer observes a vicious dog as defined herein then the animal may be caught and impounded by any police officer of the city the animal shall be impounded at a place maintained or designated by the city for that purpose b within twentyfour 24 hours of the impounding of any vicious dog the police department shall have notified the owner of the dog that the animal is being held if the city is unable to determine the owner of the animal or if the owner of the dog does not claim the animal within five 5 days from the time it is impounded then the animal may be disposed of agencies or directly by the city police department c no dog shall be disposed of until all reasonable attempts to locate the owner of the dog have been exhausted and a posting of a public notice of the description of the dog at the city hall and advising the owner or owners that they may claim the dog at the appropriate place d dogs shall be released to owners on presentation of proof of ownership and after proper inoculation licensing and payment of per diem charges impounding fees and a redemption charge all as set from time to time by the police department however not to exceed fifty dollars $5000  191979 article iii  puppy mills puppy mills a a puppy mill is hereby defined as a facility where dogs are bred for the purpose of selling them and where any two 2 of the following conditions are found to exist 1 more than twenty 20 puppies under the age of twelve 12 weeks are kept at a single time  2 no genetic heredity health testing appropriate for the breed is conducted  3 no longterm over one 1 year guarantees are offered  4 a single female is bred every cycle  5 a single female is bred more than five 5 times  6 there are no records of the dogs parents  7 more than eight 8 dogs are kept in a single cage or fenced area b it shall be unlawful for any person or entity to establish operate or maintain a puppy mill in the city of parkland c it shall be unlawful for any retailer or wholesaler who sells puppies to the public or other entities or organizations to purchase puppies from a puppy mill d any person or entity found violating this section shall be guilty of a punishable fine of up to five hundred dollars $50000 each day that the violation exists shall be considered a separate violation of this section punishable by a five hundred dollar $50000 fine  11302010 buildings and building regulations footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  interim services and facilities fee applicable to structures  2147 rightsofway adjacent lots to remain free of construction debris it shall be the responsibility of any owner of property upon which construction is occurring or any contractor responsible for such construction to ensure that all public road rightsofway remain free of debris trash or any other construction material emanating from the construction at all times during construction the owner of the property upon which the construction is occurring and the contractor shall also be responsible for ensuring that all construction debris trash and other construction material emanating from the construction is contained on the property upon which the construction occurs and during times when construction is not occurring is kept within an area which is either wirefenced or otherwise physically segregated to assure that such debris trash or other construction materials are not scattered on or elsewhere on adjacent property failure to comply with these requirements within three 3 working days shall be a violation of this section each day the violative condition exists shall be considered a separate violation of this section punishable by a fine of up to five hundred dollars $50000  2191992   damage to public rightsofway activities it shall be the responsibility of any owner of property upon which construction is occurring or any contractor laborer or material man responsible for such construction or participating in such construction or any public or private utility or cable television operator undertaking construction or repairs within the city to assure that no damage occurs to the public rightsofway of the city by virtue of such construction activity or the activity for which they are responsible including but not limited to work on the property and use of the public rightsof way by vehicles involved in the construction activities or construction equipment the owner all contractors material men laborers and public or private utilities or cable television operators undertaking construction or repairs within the city undertaking the construction activity shall be jointly and severally liable for any damages caused to the public rightsofway by their activities or those of their employees subcontractors or agents the city building official or city engineer upon a finding that damage is being caused to the public rightsofway of the city by virtue of such activity may take the following actions 1 require suspension of all building activity on the property upon which the construction is occurring  2 require immediate repair to present city standards of any damage caused to the satisfaction of the city engineer  3 require the posting of a bond prior to the resumption or continuance of any construction activity on the property to assure that any damage caused to the public rightsofway will be remedied  4 provide for the imposition of a lien on the property should the city undertake remedial action to correct the damage to the public rightsofway caused in violation of this section prior to the imposition of any lien the city shall provide notice to the owner of the property of the nature and extent of the damage and the citys intention to undertake remedial action such notice shall give the property owner ten 10 days to take such remedial action as is deemed satisfactory to the city to repair any damage upon the failure of such remedy to be effected within ten 10 days the city shall then be permitted to undertake the necessary remedial activities and by the filing of an affidavit by the city engineer to impose a lien on the property for the cost of such repairs the property owner shall receive a copy of such affidavit all notices provided herein shall be sent to the address of the property owner as listed in the most recent tax rolls available to the city  and 5 through a prosecution before the code enforcement special magistrate or in the county court impose a fine of five hundred dollars $50000 each day that damage caused in violation of this section exists shall be considered a separate violation subject to a five hundred dollar $50000 fine for each day  1151997   172009 fire fee for infrastructure including water and irrigation necessary to serve the units to be constructed  4 the applicant shall provide security in a form acceptable to the city attorney to ensure completion of
