resource recovery and management act fs ch 403  public health fs ch 381 article i  in general prohibition it is hereby declared to be unlawful for any person to place any garbage waste trash pollutants junk automobiles yard trimmings brush or organic waste material of any nature on the property of another or on streets roads or public property within the city  5141975 sludge dumping  prohibition  exception a sludge for the purposes of this chapter is hereby defined to be any organic waste material human or animal which has not been commercially heat treated so as to remove any disease causing organisms bacteria or viruses b no person shall place dump or drop any sludge within the limits of the city c any person who receives and retains a valid permit from the state of florida department of environmental regulation for such activity shall be exempt from the provisions of this section  661984 penalties any person who violates any terms or provisions of sections 71 and 72 shall upon conviction by a court of competent jurisdiction be subject to a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment not to exceed ninety 90 days or both in the discretion of the court each act of violating section 71 or 72 is a separate and distinct violation  661984 reserved editors note was repealed by  adopted feb 1 2012 formerly this section was derived from adopted oct 15 200 and pertained to municipal authority to enter certain areas of the city in the event of a natural or manmade disaster regulating the placement of abandoned vehicles a an abandoned vehicle shall be deemed to be any vehicle which is wrecked inoperative or partially dismantled and shall include motor vehicles trailers and boats which are in said condition a motor vehicle trailer or boat for which there is no valid license tag affixed to the vehicle or current registration shall constitute an abandoned vehicle for the purposes of this section b inoperative vehicle means any wrecked or partially dismantled vehicle that is parked or stored without having all the wheels mounted or is in a condition of substantial disrepair or which is parked or stored without having tires inflated or other similar condition for a period in excess of seventytwo 72 hours c it shall be unlawful for any person to store abandoned vehicles outside of an enclosed building  provided that nothing in this section shall be deemed to apply to an abandoned vehicle which is authorized to be left on private business property properly operated licensed and zoned in the city of parkland for the purposes of accepting such vehicles d when an enforcement officer of the city of parkland determines that an abandoned vehicle is being stored in violation of this section said enforcement officer shall cause a notice to be placed on an abandoned vehicle in a form containing the following information 1 notification of violation of this section containing the ordinance number or describing the nature of the violation 2 a statement of the location of the abandoned vehicle 3 a statement that the abandoned vehicle must be removed within three 3 days from the date of the notice otherwise it will be presumed to be abandoned and the matter will be brought before the code enforcement special master or the county court as a violation of the city 4 the signature of the code enforcement officer 5 such other information as is deemed appropriate by the code enforcement officer e additionally the code enforcement officer shall make a reasonable effort to ascertain the name and address of the owner of the abandoned vehicle and if such information is reasonably available the code enforcement officer shall mail by certified mail a copy of the notice to the owner this shall occur prior to the posting of the notice on the vehicle the code enforcement officer shall also mail by certified mail a copy of the above described notice to the owner of the real property upon which the abandoned vehicle is located as shown by the real estate tax records used by the broward county property appraiser f if at the end of the threeday period after posting of the notice as set forth above the owner or any person interested in such abandoned vehicle has not removed same or caused said vehicle to be in a condition where it is no longer defined as an abandoned vehicle then the matter shall proceed to enforcement action before either the code enforcement special master of the city or the county court as a municipal ordinance violation g there shall be a fine imposed for violation of this section in the amount not to exceed two hundred fifty dollars $25000 per day for each day the abandoned vehicle is permitted to remain on the property in violation of this section definitions biomedical waste shall have the meaning as set forth on florida statutes and applicable regulations under the florida administrative waste shall mean large items that normally exceed weight fifty 50 pounds or size restrictions four 4 feet in length or too large to fit in rollout cart including but not limited to white goods furniture and large branches bulk waste does not include any form of matter or debris resulting from land clearing land development or building demolition debris additionally bulk waste does not include automobiles automobile components boats internal combustion engines hazardous waste or biomedical waste bulk waste must be of a size and weight that can be managed by contractors grapple truck bulk waste shall not exceed fifteen 15 cubic yards per residential customer officer shall mean any designated employee acting as an agent of the city whose duty it is to enforce codes and ordinances enacted or adopted by the city commercial container shall mean any portable nonabsorbent enclosed container with a close fitting cover or doors approved by the contractor which is used to store large volumes of refuse utilizing containers of two 2 cubic yards or more a commercial container must be capable of being serviced by the mechanical equipment of the contractor commercial establishment shall mean any public or private place building or enterprise devoted in whole or in part to business purposes whether for profit or not for profit constructiondemolition debris shall mean materials generally considered to be not water soluble and nonhazardous in nature including but not limited to steel glass brick concrete asphalt roofing material pipe gypsum wallboard and lumber from the construction or destruction of a structure as part of a construction or demolition project and including rocks soils tree remains trees and other vegetative matter which normally results from land clearing or land development operations for a construction project as defined in 6 florida statutes as amended from time to time mixing of construction and demolition debris with other types of solid waste including material from a construction or demolition site which is not from the actual construction or destruction of a structure will cause it to be classified as other than construction and demolition debris however the inclusion of incidental solid waste generated attendant to construction or demolition activity shall not classify the same as other than construction and demolition debris curb service shall mean a single collection point within five 5 feet of the hardtopped road garbage shall mean and include all waste fruit or vegetable matter that attends or results from the preparation use handling cooking serving or storage of meats fish fowl fruit vegetable matter of any nature whatsoever which is subject to decay putrefaction and the generation of noxious and offensive gases or odors or which may serve as breeding or feeding materials for flies and other insects garbage does not include biomedical waste as described herein handicapped service shall mean service of household garbage at rear or side of house for persons as defined herein and approved by the contractor hazardous waste shall mean wastes that are hazardous by reason of their pathological explosive radiological or toxic characteristics or any other material that has been classified as hazardous by a governmental agency with the authority to regulate such material horticultural trash shall mean grass clippings shrubbery cuttings or clippings palm fronds small tree branches bushes or shrubs or other matter usually created as refuse in the care of hedges bushes and trees except large branches trees stumps or bulky or noncombustible materials large lots shall mean a lot that is one 1 acre or more in size processing center shall mean a location offering purchase sorting and preparation of recyclable materials for resale recyclable materials shall mean newspapers magazines inserts catalogs cereal boxes junk mail office paper steel cans aluminum and bimetal cans milk and juice cartons drink boxes clear glass brown and green glass plastic containers #1 2 3 4 5 and 6 and such other recyclable materials as the parties may mutually designate in writing residential customer shall mean a resident receiving solid waste services scheduled pickup shall mean  am of the day scheduled for pickup residence shall mean and include 1 singlefamily residence a detached singlefamily structure designed for occupancy by one 1 person or by one 1 family 2 duplex residence an attached twofamily structure designed or intended for occupancy by two 2 families or by one 1 person in one 1 or both units 3 multifamily residence three 3 dwelling units or more residential container shall mean and include a thirtytwogallon garbage can with handles and lid or a tied plastic garbage bag rollout cart shall mean and include 1 for garbagetrash a wheeled rollout cart used for the collection of solid waste not exceeding ninetysix 96 gallons in size with front grab bar suitable for mechanical collection 2 for recyclables a contractorissued sixtyfourgallon wheeled rollout cart white in color with a green lid and clearly labeled for recyclable materials only solid waste shall mean garbage trash and horticultural trash as defined herein this definition shall not include biomedical waste hazardous waste or construction debris as the definitions are defined herein special magistrate shall mean that person appointed by the city commission to hear alleged violations of the city prosecuted pursuant to florida statutes who is also hereby empowered to hear alleged violations of sections 731 of the city shall mean every residential or commercial waste accumulation of metal metal products glass crockery rubber excluding tires lumber sawdust or other materials white goods shall mean discarded refrigerators ranges stoves washers dryers water heaters and other similar domestic appliances  4212009   4212010   412015 use of franchises services required  disposal of hazardous material waste management or successors and assigns under the franchise agreement with the city hereinafter the franchise shall be the exclusive collector of solid waste for all residents and commercial establishments and provider of recycling services for all residences within the city boundary subject to the limitations set forth in the franchise as it may be amended from time to time and further subject to any limitations as set forth in applicable florida law the exclusive right and obligation granted by the franchise and as set forth in these regulations does not relate to stormgenerated debris that is the subject of an emergency order construction debris hazardous waste and hazardous substances as defined in florida statute   the terms of the franchise shall be deemed as part of this article and codified as appendix a in the city  4212009   4212010   412015 cross reference waste management inc of florida franchise app a art iii residential solid waste all persons occupying a residential unit or maintaining a place of residence within the city shall be provided regular solid waste and horticultural trash collection two 2 days per week the owners andor occupants shall have all accumulations of solid waste generated from such premises removed by the franchisee the franchisee shall provide twice a week collection as long as all waste set out for collection is in approved containers as provided for in the franchise and this ordinance article all ownersoccupants shall comply with this schedule containers shall be placed at curbside no more than twentyfour 24 hours prior to scheduled pickup scheduled pickup shall be construed to mean  am of the day scheduled for pickup residential customers who are physically or mentally challenged and for which there is no adult living in the residence who is capable of placing the containers at the curb may elect handicapped service at no additional charge the franchisee shall provide an appropriate form for such residents to complete together with required documentation corroborating such status the city shall make the final decision in the event of a dispute between the franchisee and resident over residents right to have handicapped service  4212009   4212010   412015 commercial solid waste collection all persons occupying a commercial establishment or maintaining a place of business within the city shall be provided regular solid waste collection a minimum of one 1 time per week to the extent permitted by law the city shall require the owners andor occupants to subscribe to the solid waste collection service and have all accumulation of solid waste generated from such premises removed by the franchisee in the event of a dispute between the franchisee and a commercial establishment as to the level of service pursuant to a contract for service between the two 2 parties then either party may take the matter to the city manager for resolution the decision of the city manager shall be final  4212010   412015 bulk collection 1 service the franchisee shall provide a citywide bulk pickup service twelve 12 times per contract year at no additional cost to the city or residents bulk pickup schedules shall be established annually and shall be scheduled in onemonth intervals the bulk pickup shall be at curbside the same as the normal pickups and shall include but not be limited to bulky household items discarded furniture etc bulk pickups shall not include construction debris tree stumps or mature trees unless reduced to four 4 feet in size and weight that can be managed by the franchisees grapple truck the following setout rules apply to bulk pickups a bulk waste shall be placed curbside in a neat and orderly manner no more than fortyeight 48 hours prior to scheduled pickup for large lots or seventytwo 72 hours prior to scheduled pickup for large lots when a weekend is included in the fortyeighthour or seventytwohour time frame scheduled pickup shall be construed to mean  am of the day scheduled for pickup b cut tree trunks logs and large limbs into sections not to exceed four 4 feet and stack neatly at the curb c cut lumber metal poles and other items of this nature into sections not to exceed four 4 feet d bulk waste set out for collection must not be placed close to a mailbox fire hydrant cable box utility pole fence or car e bulk waste set out for collection shall not be placed within ten 10 feet of any ditches swales andor canals nor in a manner which would allow bulk waste to fall into a ditch swale andor canal f bulk waste set out for collection shall be placed on residents property unless the following three 3 conditions are met 1 prior written notice is given to the citys public works department  and 2 prior written approval is obtained from the property owner upon which the bulk waste is to be placed  and 3 the property owner upon whose property the bulk waste is placed is paying for bulk waste collection g white goods shall have chlorofluorocarbons cfcs removed prior to set out additional bulk pickups may be provided by the franchisee or city at additional cost to residents  the cost to be determined by the city  4212010   412015 compliance with franchise all persons entities and properties which are subject to the franchise as set forth in appendix a of the city comply with the provisions therein and shall be obligated to comply with the provisions stated herein for the exclusive collection of the solid waste set forth therein by the franchisee  4212010   412015 solid waste and recyclable materials with regard to all solid waste and recyclable materials all residences shall comply with the collection schedule as designated by the city manager of the city of parkland the collection schedule shall be set forth in a written order from the city manager  a copy of said order shall be on file with the city clerk and shall be on the city of parkland website this schedule is subject to change by further written order of the city manager all residences and businesses are required to comply with the procedures for collection of solid waste and recyclables as set forth herein each owner occupier caretaker or tenant of a residential dwelling unit in the city of parkland shall separate all designated recyclable materials from other refuse in accordance with the provisions of this section irrespective of whether or not said dwelling unit receives paid solid waste services all residential units or developments apartments or condominium complexes where recycling materials are placed for collection as part of a group of residential units hereinafter referred to as residential developments shall source separate recovered materials at the location where the recovered materials are generated residential singlefamily residences receiving curb side service shall place all recyclable materials in sixtyfivegallon roll cart approved by the city roll carts shall be placed at the curb side location or at such other singular collection point as may be agreed on between the hauler and the customer and in compliance with all city codes and requirements all containers shall be kept in a safe accessible clean location as designated or approved by the city and agreed to by the hauler and the customer the city may impose reasonable requirements on the location where said containers are placed if a hauler provides a recyclable materials container to its customers the hauler will be responsible for the proper maintenance of the container customers that acquire their own containers from any other source are responsible for the proper maintenance of the container except that damage done by the hauler shall be the responsibility of the hauler  and for ensuring that the container can be serviced by the registrants equipment for multifamily customers using a separate recycling dumpster corrugated cardboard shall be segregated from all other solid waste material and must be flattened and placed into a recycling dumpster material shall be free of food dirt grease tape or liquid and other contaminants wax coated cardboard pizza boxes shoe boxes cereal boxes and cake mix boxes are acceptable and shall be placed into the same designated dumpster as corrugated cardboard  4212010   8152012   412015 rates at the citys option all singlefamily and duplex residents shall be billed for services provided herein nonad valorem assessment on their tax bill and shall be subject to the provisions thereof all business owners multifamily residences and other persons serviced as provided herein shall establish an account and pay the rates as charged by the franchisee for the services set forth herein singlefamily and duplex accounts whose tax bills do not reflect a nonad valorem assessment for solid waste and recycling services for any reason will be charged an annual fee directly by franchisee which will be prorated accordingly under the proper circumstances such properties will be placed on the next years tax bill as a nonad valorem assessment the failure to pay the franchisee in a timely fashion as determined by the city shall be deemed a violation of this article the rate schedule as provided for in appendix a attached hereto as exhibit a are hereby adopted and imposed together with any automatic adjustments provided therein  4212010   412015 enforcement procedure and penalties violations of the provisions and prohibitions of this article shall constitute an offense and violation of the city punishable as set forth below the city adopts the following supplemental method for enforcement of violations of sections 731  1 officers shall have the authority to initiate enforcement proceedings by issuing citations that may require an appearance of the violator for an administrative hearing before a special magistrate 2 a code enforcement officer who finds a violation of any part of sections 731 shall have the authority to serve a notice of violation to the violator which notice shall alternately be referred to as a citation prior to issuing a citation the code enforcement officer shall provide a written notice to the person in violation that the person has committed a violation and establish a reasonable period of time for the person to correct the violation such time period shall no more than ten 10 calendar days the notice may be hand delivered or mailed by regular mail if upon personal investigation the code enforcement officer finds that the person has not corrected the violation within the designated time period the code enforcement officer may issue a citation to the person who has committed the violation  the property owner which placed the solid waste or bulk waste for collection shall be deemed the violator 3 the code enforcement officer is not required to provide the alleged violator with a reasonable period of time to collect the violation prior to issuing the notice to appear if a repeat violation is found or if the code enforcement officer has reason to believe that the violation presents a serious threat to the public health safety or welfare or that the violator is engaged in violations of a itinerant or transient nature or if the violation is irreparable or irreversible a repeat violation is a violation of a provision of code or ordinance by a person who has been previously found in violation by a code enforcement special magistrate or process set forth herein or any other quasijudicial or judicial process to have violated or who has admitted violating the same provision within five 5 years prior to the violation notwithstanding the violations occur at different locations 4 the citation form shall include but not be limited to the following a date and time of issuance  b name of the code enforcement officer and jurisdiction  c name and address of the violator  d that has been violated  e brief description of the nature of the violation including location date and time of violation  f amount of the applicable civil penalty  g procedure of the person to follow to pay the civil penalty or to contest the citation  h notice that if the person fails to pay the civil penalty within the time allowed and fails to request an administrative hearing within ten 10 calendar days of service if case assigned to special magistrate the person shall be deemed to have waived their rights to contest the citation and that in such case judgment may be entered up to the maximum civil penalty as set forth herein i notice that the person may be liable for reasonable costs of the hearing should the violator be found guilty of the violation 5 service of the citation shall be evidenced by a citation signed by the violator or by certified mail return receipt requested provided the citation is sent to the owner of the property in question at the address listed with the property appraisers office and at any other address provided to the local government by such owner if the certified mail is returned as unclaimed or refused service may be provided by posting at least ten 10 days prior to the scheduled hearing date in at least two 2 locations one 1 of which shall be the property upon which the violation exists and the other shall be in parkland city hall in addition a copy of the citation must be sent by first class mail proof of posting shall be by affidavit of the person posting the citation which affidavit shall include a copy of the notice posted and the date and places of its posting 6 the following procedure shall be followed upon issuance of a citation a the person who has been served with a citation to appear before a special magistrate shall either correct the violation and pay the civil penalty in the manner indicated on the citation  or b request an administrative hearing before a special magistrate to appeal the decision of the code enforcement officer said appeal shall be in writing and shall be tiled not later than ten 10 calendar days after the service of the citation c the hearing shall be set by the city clerk no earlier than ten 10 days after receipt of the notice of appeal and no more than fortyfive 45 days after receiving the notice the city clerk shall mail notice of the hearing date to the alleged violator at least seven 7 calendar days before the hearing by certified mail return receipt requested failure to claim the mailed notice shall not cause the notice to be deemed deficient 7 the notice of hearing shall include but not be limited to the following a name of the inspector who issued the notice  b factual description of alleged violation  c date of alleged violation  d the code allegedly violated  e place date and time of the hearing  f right of violator to be represented by an attorney  g right of violator to present witnesses and evidence  h notice that failure of violator to attend hearing may result in imposition of a civil penalty i notice that requests for continuances will not be considered if not received in writing by the code enforcement officer at least ten 10 calendar days prior to the date set for hearing 8 at the hearing the city shall have the burden of proof by a preponderance of the evidence that a violation exists the special magistrate has the authority to conduct the hearing in manner consistent with the rules set forth herein and to take all necessary actions to carry out the rules and procedures set forth herein in order to reach a decision based upon the evidence presented the strict rules of evidence shall not apply at the hearing but the hearing officer shall conduct the hearing so as to assure that the rights of fundamental due process have been provided the alleged violator the city and the alleged violator may introduce evidence and call witnesses and cross examine witnesses any evidence that the special magistrate deems competent and reliable may be admitted regardless of the existence of some statutory or common law rule to the contrary all testimony shall be under oath the special magistrate shall issue a written order either affirming the decision of the code enforcement office reversing said decision or modifying said decision  if the order finds a violation the special magistrate shall issue findings of fact 9 failure of the violator to appeal the decision of the code enforcement officer within the ten 10 calendar days shall constitute a waiver of the violators right to an administrative hearing a waiver of the right to an administrative hearing shall be treated as an admission of the violation and may result in the imposition of a fine against the violator for an amount up to the maximum civil penalty as set forth below 10 should the violator appeal the citation and be found in violation by the special magistrate in addition to the imposition of a fine the violator shall be assessed an administrative cost of one hundred and fifty dollars $15000 the special magistrate shall not waive the administrative costs should the violator waive their right to an administrative hearing in addition to the imposition of the fine the violator shall be assessed an administrative cost of twentyfive dollars $2500 that shall not be waived by the special magistrate 11 the following constitutes the fines for violation of sections 731  a first offense  $10000 b second offense  $20000 c third and subsequent offenses  $25000 d the special magistrate shall have authority to mitigate the amount of any fine provided for herein based upon a finding that given the circumstances presented at the hearing a fine in accordance with the standards set forth herein is not justified based upon and one 1 of the following i the violator acted in good faith to cure the violation in the time provided  or ii the violator can show special circumstances existed which made cure within the time provided a hardship which hardship was not shared by others similarly situated the administrative fee may not be waived 12 the city manager or hisher designee shall provide the appropriate guidelines and procedures for the administration collection record keeping reporting and accountability of fines assessed under this article 13 if the special magistrate finds that a violation exists and assesses the fine or if the violator does not contest the citation as provided under this article and the violator fails to pay the applicable fine the special magistrate may enter an order imposing the fines previously set plus administrative costs a certified copy of the order imposing a civil penalty plus administrative costs may be recorded in the public records and thereafter shall constitute a lien against the real or personal property of the violator upon petition to the circuit court such order may be enforced in the same manner as a court judgment by the sheriffs of this state including a levy against personal property but not be deemed to be a court judgment except for enforcement purposes in the alternative after three 3 months from the filing of any such lien remains unpaid the city may foreclose or otherwise execute on the lien no lien created pursuant to the provisions of this section may be foreclosed on real property that is homestead under of the state constitution in addition to all remedies the city may institute proceedings in a court of competent jurisdiction to compel payment of civil penalties 14 a party may seek a rehearing of the case by filing a written motion for rehearing within ten 10 calendar days of rendition of the decision by the special magistrate the motion for rehearing shall set forth issues which were overlooked or omitted at the hearing but shall not consist of reargument of the case the party filing the motion is responsible for forwarding a copy of the motion to the other party the city clerk shall immediately forward the motion for rehearing to the special magistrate and within ten 10 days of receipt of the motion the special magistrate may enter an order on the motion for rehearing or schedule a hearing on the motion if the motion for rehearing is granted the case shall be set for rehearing as soon as possible thereafter 15 all filings shall be made with the city clerk who shall set all hearings and provide all notices as required herein 16 a party may appeal a decision of a special magistrate by certiorari to the seventeenth judicial circuit within thirty 30 days of the date of the rendition of the decision of the special magistrate as provided by the florida rules of appellate procedure  412015 secs 740749  reserved article iii  private collection private collection services for recovered materials at commercial establishments a intent it is the intent of the city and the purpose of this subsection to promote the public health safety and general welfare by authorizing a registration program within the city for the collection of recovered materials b definitions for the purpose of this section the following terms shall have meanings indicated in the event any definition in this section conflicts with the definition in fs   the definition in fs   controls certified recovered materials dealer means a dealer certified under fs   commercial establishments mean a property or properties zoned or used for commercial or industrial uses or used by an entity exempt from taxation under section 501c3 of the internal revenue excludes property or properties zoned for singlefamily residential or multifamily residential uses construction and demolition debris means discarded materials generally considered to be not water soluble and nonhazardous in nature including but not limited to steel glass brick concrete asphalt roofing material pipe gypsum wallboard and lumber from the construction or destruction of a structure as part of a construction or demolition project or from the renovation of a structure and including rocks soils tree remains trees and other vegetative matter that normally results from land clearing or land development operations for a construction project including such debris from construction of structures at a site remote from the construction or demolition project site mixing of construction and demolition debris with other types of solid waste will cause it to be classified as other than construction and demolition debris the term also includes 1 clean cardboard paper plastic wood and metal scraps from a construction project  and 2 except as provided in florida statutes 12j unpainted nontreated wood scraps from facilities manufacturing materials used for construction of structures or their components and unpainted nontreated wood pallets provided the wood scraps and pallets are separated from the other solid waste where generated and the generator of such wood scraps or pallets implements reasonable practice of the generating industry to minimize the commingling of wood scraps or pallets with other solid waste  and 3 de minimis amount or other nonhazardous wastes that are generated at construction or destruction projects provided such amounts are consistent with best management practices of the industry fiscal means october 1  person means any and all persons natural or artificial including any individual firm or association partnership joint venture or other entity of any kind type or description engaging in the conduct or activity with which this section is concerned recovered materials means metal paper glass plastic textile or rubber materials that have known recycling potential can be feasibly recycled and have been diverted and source separated or have been removed from the solid waste stream for sale use or reuse as raw materials whether or not the materials require subsequent processing or separation from each other but does not include materials destined for any use that constitutes disposal recovered materials as described above are not solid waste construction and demolition debris is not a recovered material and therefore shall constitute solid waste registrant means a certified recovered materials dealer who has registered with the city in accordance with the requirements of this section solid waste management facility means any solid waste disposal area volume reduction plant transfer station materials recovery facility or other facility the purpose of which is resource recovery or the disposal recycling processing or storage of solid waste the term does not include recovered materials processing facilities which meet the requirements of fs except the portion of such facilities if any that is used for the management of solid waste these facilities are prohibited in the city sourceseparated means the recovered materials that are separated from solid waste where the recovered materials and solid waste are generated the term does not require that various types of recovered materials be separated from each other and recognizes de minimis solid waste in accordance with industry standards and practices may be included with recovered materials materials are not considered source separated when two 2 or more types of recovered materials are deposited in combination with each other in a commercial collection container located where the materials are generated and such materials contain more than ten 10 percent solid waste by volume or weight for purposes of this subsection the term various types of recovered materials means metals paper glass plastic textiles and rubber yard trash means vegetative matter resulting from landscaping maintenance and land clearing operations this section adopts those definitions contained within florida statutes   c registration and application 1 registration and application any person who engages in the purchasing transporting and processing of recovered materials at commercial establishments shall register with the city in accordance with the requirements of this section the registrant shall submit an original and one 1 copy of all required information to the recycling coordinator the registration required by this section shall be in addition to and not satisfied by any business tax receipt which may be required applications for registration required by this section shall be made to the city upon such form and in such manner as prescribed by the city the application shall be in such form to elicit the following information and such other information as may be required from time to time a registration fee to be acceptable for filing an application for registration shall be accompanied by a registration fee in the following amount as appropriate initial registration application or reapplication  $50000 annual renewal registration  50000 transfer of registration  10000 b name and address of the dealerregistrant including the identification of the owner or operator for the dealer  if the applicant is a business entity its general partner or limited partners its corporate officers and directors any applicant that operates under a fictitious name shall submit information that such fictitious name is registered in the state of florida and held by the applicant  c its permanent place of business and mailing address if different  d a copy of the registrants recovered materials certification under florida statutes    and e certification that the recovered materials will be processed at a recovered materials processing facility satisfying the requirements of florida statutes as amended from time to time 2 all commercial establishments that engage in recycling recovered materials in the city shall register yearly with the city on a form provided by the city by october 1 of each year and pay a yearly registration fee of one hundred dollars $10000 for each service location in the city said form shall contain the name and address of the commercial establishment the owner of the commercial establishment and the name and address of its contracted hauler of recovered materials if the commercial establishment hauls its own recovered materials an owner hauler it must provide the name and address of the recovered materials dealer with which it contracts and the address of the recovered materials processing facility and shall comply with reporting requirements established for the nonexclusive franchise hauler by the city the owner hauler must also comply with the requirement for disposal of any and all solid waste 3 signatures submission a the registration and application for hauling recovered materials shall be signed by the individual submitting the application or in the case of a corporation by a corporate officer thereof or in the case of a partnership or other association by a member of the partnership or association provided however that for a publicly held corporation which has twentyfive 25 or more shareholders the signatures of the local managing officer shall be sufficient the completed registration shall be submitted to the recycling coordinator b an affidavit or declaration of the applicant or authorized officer certifying the truth and accuracy of the information in the application acknowledging the enforceability of the application commitments and certifying that the application meets all federal state and local law requirements c a signed statement by the applicant as part of the process that it is understood that the mixing of recovered materials with garbage or trash contaminates the product and renders it garbage or trash in other words garbage and trash shall not be mixed with recovered materials and shall be source separated 4 once it has been determined by the recycling coordinator or his designee that the registration application is complete upon approval of the registration registrants shall be entitled to operate for a period of one 1 year from the date of issuance  provided however the registration shall be for the period of october 1 of each fiscal year 5 in addition to the above the registrant shall meet the following requirements a registrant must provide to the city a copy of the recovered materials reporting forms as submitted to the state of florida department of environmental protection b the reporting format and reporting frequency shall be established by the city pursuant to fs which shall at a minimum include requiring the dealer to identify the types and approximate amount of recovered materials collected recycled or reused during the reporting period emanating from the city  the approximate percentage of recovered materials reused stored or delivered to a recovered materials processing facility or disposed of in a solid waste disposal facility  and the locations where any recovered materials were disposed of as solid waste from the city information reported under this subsection which if disclosed would reveal a trade secret as defined in  1c is confidential and exempt from the provisions of section 24a of the state constitution and 1 the above notwithstanding any and all required reports shall be in accordance with rule florida administrative as amended from time to time c sourceseparated all recovered material provided however that containers of mixed types of recovered materials which contain more than ten 10 percent solid waste shall not be deemed to be source separated d vehicles used to transport recovered materials shall meet all applicable regulations of the florida department of transportation and shall be capable of preventing spillage or accidental release of recovered materials during transport e the registrant shall provide service to any commercial property between the hours of  am and  pm f the registrant shall comply with all applicable federal state and local laws regulations and ordinances g registrant shall conduct all collection handling and processing of recovered materials in accordance with the requirements of this section and the certification issued pursuant to rule 62722 florida administrative as amended from time to time h in no event shall the registrant perform commercial solid waste services under the guise of collecting transporting processing or disposing of recovered materials i registrant shall not deliver recovered materials to a facility which is permitted as solid waste management facility unless the registrant has given prior notification to the citys recycling coordinator and registrant has received authorization to utilize such facility j registrant shall provide a copy of its certification and registration to any commercial generator of recovered materials the registrants agents and contractors or to customers who request such proof of registration 5 if any of the registration information submitted by the registrant changes during the terms of the registration the registrant shall report those changes to the city within thirty 30 calendar days of the change 6 the registrant shall pay to the city the required annual renewal of the registration fee between september 1 and october 1 of each fiscal year to be paid in advance d transferability no registration issued pursuant to this section may be assigned or transferred without the prior written approval of the city e inspection of books and records the city shall have the right at all times upon reasonable notice to inspect the relevant books and records of registrant the inspection shall be for the purpose of verifying that the registrant is in compliance with the requirements of this section the books and records of the registrant shall be maintained at a location within broward county florida or produced at such location upon request of the city f all storage containers shall comply with city and state standards immediately upon adoption of this article  semitrucks or trailers may not be used to store containers or recycled materials overnight within the city g violation  penalty 1 violation each violation of this section or any of its subsections is deemed a separate and distinct infraction of this   however for the first violation of operating without a registration the hauler or dealer shall be given a written warning and allowed five 5 calendar days to apply for and receive the required registration until such time as the required registration is obtained no person shall engage in the conduct or activity with which this section is concerned 2 penalty any person who violates any provision of this section shall be punished as provided herein a fine each violation of this section shall be punishable by a minimum fine of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 a maximum fine of five hundred dollars $50000 may be assessed plus the costs associated with investigation and prosecution together with any equitable remedies deemed reasonable and property by the court b revocation the violation of the terms and conditions of this section may be cause for revocation or registration the city manager may upon consistent and repeated violations of this section revoke a registration for a violation as aforementioned and may immediately declare such registration null and void and upon such declaration the hauler issued the registration shall immediately cease all operations and shall be considered to have forfeited such registration and the rights acquired thereunder should the city manager decide to revoke a registration heshe shall provide the hauler with notice of such revocation and the reasons therefore such notice shall be sent certified mail return receipt requested upon receipt of such notice the hauler may appeal such revocation to the city commission and the appeal and hearing thereon shall be conducted in accordance with the following procedures 1 should a hauler seek appeal from the revocation of the registration the applicant shall furnish notice of such request for appeal to the city clerk no later than twenty 20 calendar days after the date of receipt of the certified letter advising the applicant of revocation of the registration 2 upon receipt of a request for appeal the city clerk shall thereupon fix the date and time at which the city commission shall hear the appeal such hearing to be held not less than ten 10 nor more than thirty 30 calendar days subsequent to the date upon which such request for appeal was filed with the city clerk upon setting the matter for hearing the city clerk shall notify the applicant of the date and time of such hearing at the conclusion of the hearing the city commission shall either sustain the decision of the city manager or direct the city manager to issue a registration c other enforcement nothing in this section shall prohibit the city from enforcing this section by other means exemptions the registration requirements required of this section shall not be required by persons exempt pursuant to rule florida administrative as amended from time to time effective  an approved registration as described herein must be held by all haulers who provide collection services for recovered materials with the city  9182002   4212009 mandatory commercial recycling it is determined by the city that it is appropriate to require that commercial establishments separate commercial material the city adopts the findings of the florida legislature that the failure and inability to economically recover material and energy resources from solid waste results in the unnecessary waste and depletion of our natural resources and therefore warrants that the maximum resource recovery from solid waste and the maximum recycling and reuse of such resources must be considered a goal of the city as well as the state of florida in order to further these purposes the city hereby requires that all commercial establishments shall be required to separate recovered materials to make them available for recycling 1 definitions for the purposes of this section the definitions as set forth in the florida statutes shall apply a commercial establishment shall mean any public or private place building or enterprise devoted in whole or part to a commercial enterprise whether for profit or not for profit or any enterprise that is required or does have a city occupational license this definition shall be deemed to exclude any residents or other operation otherwise excluded by state law 2 mandatory recycling all commercial establishments shall source separate recovered materials at the location where the recovered materials are generated and make said materials available for commercial haulers who are registered with the city for the purpose of collecting and properly disposing of said recycled materials the commercial establishment shall be permitted to choose a commercial hauler of its choice so long as said hauler is registered with the city and properly complies with all state and city regulations 3 collection and disposal recyclable materials collected pursuant to this section shall transport the collected recyclable materials to a licensed and permitted processing center designated by the hauler the hauler shall take title to the recyclable materials upon collection from the commercial establishment and shall be responsible for the sale and disposal of such recyclable materials in a manner consistent with state law the hauler shall insure that all recyclable materials are processed for future use to the extent possible and shall not be disposed of as solid waste corrugated cardboard shall be segregated from all other solid waste material by all commercial solid waste customers and must be flattened and placed into a recycling dumpster material shall be free of food dirt grease tape or liquid and other contaminants wax coated cardboard pizza boxes shoe boxes cereal boxes and cake mix boxes are acceptable and shall be placed into the same designated dumpster as corrugated cardboard recycling dumpsters for corrugated cardboard and cardboard boxes shall be supplied by the owner of the commercial establishment where the commercial operations are conducted 4 containers all recyclable materials shall be placed in an appropriate industry standard container where garbage containers are used they shall be placed at the location or at such other singular collection point as may be agreed on between the hauler and the customer and in compliance with all city codes and requirements all containers shall be kept in a safe accessible clean location as designated or approved by the city and agreed to by the hauler and the customer the city may impose reasonable requirements on the location where said containers are placed if a hauler provides a recyclable materials container to its customers the hauler will be responsible for the proper maintenance of the container customers that acquire their own containers from any other source are responsible for the proper maintenance of the container except that damage done by the hauler shall be the responsibility of the hauler  and for ensuring that the container can be serviced by the registrants equipment 5 proof of participation a commercial establishment generator of recyclable materials or owner of a commerciallycollected property shall produce proof of a valid and current contract with a registrant or receipts for delivery of recyclable materials to an approved site upon request of the city manager or designee  422008 secs 752759  reserved private collection services for commercial andor residential construction and demolition debris and waste a permit no person shall remove or transport construction and demolition debris and waste from commercial singlefamily and multifamily residential construction sites over the streets or public rightsofway of the city or its real property for hire or salvage without first applying for and receiving from the city a permit for hauling commercial andor residential construction and demolition debris and waste commercial andor residential construction and demolition debris and waste for the purposes of this section includes recyclable construction material the permit required by this section shall be in addition to and not satisfied by any business tax receipt which may be required b application applications for a permit required by this section shall be made to the city upon such form and in such manner as prescribed by the city the application shall be in such form to elicit the following information and such other information as may be required from time to time 1 character of applicant the applicant for a permit if an individual or in the case of a firm corporation partnership association or organization any person having any financial controlling or managerial interest therein shall be in good standing in making such determination the following information which shall be submitted by the applicant shall be considered a if the applicant is a partnership or corporation the name and business address of the principal officers and stockholders and other persons having any financial or controlling interest in the partnership or corporation provided however that if the corporation is a publicly owned corporation having more than twentyfive 25 shareholders then only the name and business address of the local managing officers shall be required b if the applicant is an individual a record of all convictions and the reasons therefore shall be provided by the applicant if the applicant is other than an individual then the record of all convictions and the reason therefore of the principal controlling officers of the applicant shall be provided provided however that in the case of a publicly held corporation having twentyfive 25 or more shareholders then only the aforementioned information applicable to its local managing officers shall be required c whether such applicant has operated a solid waste collectionremoval business in this or another state under a franchise permit or license and if so whether such franchise permit or license has ever been revoked or suspended and the reasons therefore d if the applicant is a corporation the application shall submit proof of incorporation in good standing in the state and if a foreign corporation the applicant shall provide information certifying that the applicant is qualified to do business in the state if the applicant is other than a corporation and is operating under a fictitious name the applicant shall be required to submit information that such fictitious name is registered in the state and held by the applicant 2 equipment and method of operation a the applicant for a permit shall possess equipment capable of providing safe and efficient service in making such a determination the following will be considered and the applicant shall furnish to the building department information as to 1 the type and number of pieces of equipment to be used 2 a description of the method of collection and removal to be employed 3 license plate number for each vehicle 4 commercial drivers license numbers for operators of vehicles b all portable waste containers dumpster or rolloff shall be imprinted with the owners name and telephone number in block letters which are at least two 2 inches high c all containers shall be kept in a good state of repair 3 signatures  submission an application for a permit for hauling commercial andor residential construction and demolition debris shall be signed by the individual submitting the application or in the case of a corporation by a corporate officer thereof or in the case of a partnership or other association by a member of the partnership or association provided however that for a publicly held corporation which has twentyfive 25 or more shareholders the signatures of the local managing officer shall be sufficient the completed application shall be submitted to the director of the building department or hisher designee 4 permit issuance upon providing the necessary information applicants shall be entitled to a permit for a period of up to one 1 year from the date of issuance  provided however the permit shall be for the period of october 1 of each calendar year the following requirements must be met a the applicant has paid the city the permit fee as required by this section b the applicant has furnished proof of insurance as required by this section c the applicant has executed a license agreement with the city which shall include but is not limited to a condition that the applicant shall dispose of all commercial andor residential construction debris and waste at designated locations hours of collection indemnification provisions termination provisions collection equipment and insurance provisions and a condition that all such disposal shall be in accordance with all federal state and local laws and ordinances such agreement shall be executed on behalf of the city by the director of the building department or hisher designee c annual permit fees the applicant shall pay the city the annual permit fee of three thousand dollars $300000 for each permit obtained between october 1 and march 31 the full fee for one 1 year shall be paid for each permit obtained from april 1 to september 30 onehalf 12 of the full fee for one 1 year shall be paid d insurance requirements before commencing service under a license agreement to haul commercial andor residential construction and demolition debris and waste each licensee shall maintain insurance as required by city and shall furnish proof of insurance to the citys risk manager e renewal a permit for the collection of residential construction debris and waste required by this section shall be renewed annually any such renewal shall be subject to the same terms and conditions applicable to the issuance of the permit as specified in this section and the fees prevailing at that time f termination failure on the part of any permitted hauler to comply with the conditions of this section shall be just cause for the revocation of the permit upon revocation of a permit the hauler shall immediately remove all vehicles and equipment and discontinue all hauling operations within the city g violation and penalty any person or entity found in violation of this section after notice and failure to correct within twentyfour 24 hours shall pay a fine of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 per day for each day the violation or violative condition exists h transferability no permit issued pursuant to this section may be assigned or transferred i impoundment of vehicles 1 a vehicle may be removed and impounded by enforcement personnel when a person continues to use a vehicle for the collection of residential demolition and construction debris under the following conditions a the permit issued to the waste hauler has been revoked by the city in accordance with the provisions of this section of the code  or b the waste hauler has been issued written warning for operating without the required permit has been allowed ten 10 calendar days to apply for and receive the required permit and continues to operate without a permit c the waste hauler has been issued a citation after a written warning and continues to operate without a permit loading of such waste material into a portable waste container or on a truck or trailer licensed for road use shall be deemed to constitute collection 2 any vehicle removed or impounded shall be taken to a garage which has been designated and is maintained by the city for the storage of impounded vehicles 3 the charge for towing or removal of any vehicle under this section and storage charges shall be based upon the actual expenses incurred in such towing and storage and shall be payable by the owner of such vehicle if towing or storage is accomplished by the city the cost thereof shall be a reasonable cost 4 whenever enforcement personnel remove an impounded vehicle as provided in this section such personnel shall give notice to the owner of such vehicle of the fact of such removal the reasons therefore and the place to which the vehicle has been removed provided however that if it is not possible to ascertain the name and address of the owner then in that event enforcement personnel shall send a written report of the removal and impoundment to the commissioner of motor vehicles of the state and shall file a copy of such notice and report with the proprietor of the garage in which the vehicle the date time and place it was impounded the reasons for such removal and impoundment and the name of the garage or place where the vehicle is stored 5 any vehicle impounded pursuant to this section may be held by the city for a period of time not to exceed sixty 60 days  provided however that a vehicle shall be released when the owner thereof obtains a permit or has a revoked permit reinstated 6 vehicles shall be released upon the approval of the city manager no vehicle shall be released until all expenses for towing and storage are paid any vehicle impounded and stored by the city and which is not claimed and removed by the owner thereof upon the expiration of a sixtyday period of time may be sold at public auction and the proceeds applied to towing and storage costs j violation  penalty 1 violation each violation of this section or any of its subsections is deemed a separate and distinct infraction of this   however for the first violation of operating without a permit the waste hauler shall be given a written warning and allowed ten 10 calendar days to apply for and receive the required permit 2 penalty any person who violates any provision of this section shall be punished as provided herein a fine each violation of this section shall be punishable by a minimum civil penalty of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 a maximum civil penalty of five hundred dollars $50000 may be assessed plus the costs associated with investigation and prosecution together with any equitable remedies deemed reasonable and proper by the court b revocation the violation of any of the terms and conditions of this section or the violation of any of the terms and conditions of the agreement required pursuant to this section may be cause for revocation of the permit the city manager may revoke a permit for a violation as aforementioned and may immediately declare such permit null and void and upon such declaration the hauler issued the permit shall immediately cease all operations and shall be considered to have forfeited such permit and the rights acquired thereunder should the city manager decide to revoke a permit he shall provide the hauler with notice of such revocation and the reasons therefore such notice shall be sent certified mail return receipt requested upon receipt of such notice the hauler may appeal such revocation to the city commission and the appeal and hearing thereof shall be conducted in accordance with the following procedures 1 should a hauler seek appeal from the revocation of the permit the applicant shall furnish notice of such request for appeal to the city clerk no later than twenty 20 calendar days after the date of receipt of the certified letter advising applicant of revocation of the permit 2 upon receipt of a request for appeal the city clerk shall thereupon fix the date and time at which the city commission shall hear the appeal such hearing to be held not less than ten 10 nor more than sixty 60 calendar days subsequent to the date upon which such request for appeal was filed with the city clerk upon setting the matter for hearing the city clerk shall notify the applicant of the date and time of such hearing at the conclusion of the hearing the city commission shall either sustain the decision of the city manager or direct the city manager to issue a permit c other enforcement nothing in this section shall prohibit the city from enforcing this section by other means k effective date effective  a permit as described herein must be held by all haulers who provide collection services for residential construction and demolition debris and waste and all haulers shall enter into a license agreement with the city  182003   4212009 licenses footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  peddlers and solicitors ch 12 state footnotes  1  case law annotations a municipality may enact an ordinance which create an offense against municipal law for the same act that constitutes an offense against state law jaramillo v city of homestead 322 so 2d 496 fla 1975 similarly a municipality by ordinance may adopt state misdemeanor statutes by specific reference or by the general reference contained in the ordinance id such an adoption by general reference as contained in the ordinance permits subsequent amendments revisions and repeals of the laws by the state legislature to apply to the municipal ordinances id cross ch 901  notice in lieu of arrest fs  90127 et seq article i  in general adoption of state misdemeanors all of the misdemeanors of the laws of the state are hereby made a part of this chapter by reference as if set out verbatim  4251966 violation violation of any of the misdemeanor laws of the state as the same now exists or as may be hereinafter enacted shall be a violation of this chapter if the same is committed within the limits of the city  4251966 fishing and hunting prohibited it is prohibited for any person other than a resident or property owner of this city and their guests to either fish or hunt with a rifle shotgun or airgun within the limits of this city  4251966 graffiti  destruction of property or vegetation  actions of minors  parental responsibility  penalty  reward a definitions as used in this section the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed herein 1 law enforcement officer means any member of the parkland public safety department or its designee authorized to enforce all criminal and traffic laws and ordinances within the city 2 minor means any person under the age of eighteen 18 years b graffiti prohibited it is unlawful for any person to inscribe draw or otherwise place upon the surface of any structure as defined in the south florida building or real property that is privately or publicly owned any work phrase diagram symbol sketch or letters where the contents thereof are visible from any other public or private property and contain references to sexual activity or to any portion of the human anatomy references to criminal activities or to groups which promote or are involved in criminal activity swearing or fighting words defamatory materials about any person references to personal relationships or to defamatory material about public or private persons the above list is not to be limiting but merely illustrative of items known to be graffiti it shall be a defense to the alleged violation of the foregoing provision if such activity was undertaken with the prior written consent of the owner of the property demonstrating that the owner was aware of the content and the method by which the inscription was to be placed upon the structure or real property  except that any inscription occupying a surface area of over four 4 square feet shall not be excused even if made with the consent of the owner c graffiti removal it shall be the duty of the owner of the structure or wall upon which any inscription or representation prohibited in the preceding subsection is made to remove such inscription or representation and to otherwise repair or restore the structure or wall to its prior condition within three 3 business days from the occurrence of the offence if the graffiti is not removed within three 3 business days from the occurrence of the offense an owner must remove the graffiti within three 3 business days after receiving written notification from the city if the graffiti is not removed within three 3 business days after receiving notification the city will remove graffiti and charge the property owner associated costs a fine of between fifty dollars $5000 and five hundred dollars $50000 may be imposed for each offense and for each day the graffiti is not removed any person who made the prohibited inscription shall be subject to a fine of between one hundred dollars $10000 and five hundred dollars $50000 and restitution required hereunder this subsection may be enforced notice to appear in county court or code enforcement board c1 restitution the owner of the property shall be entitled to restitution and compensation for the direct costs incurred in the repair and restoration of his property from any person convicted of the prohibited activity upon the submission of receipts evidencing payments of such costs and providing the court entering the finding or conviction for the offense shall so order d vegetation it shall be unlawful for any person unless authorized licensed or invited to cut root up or otherwise injure or destroy any tree shrub plant or other growing thing on public property without the consent of the owner thereof e misconduct of minor  parental liability any act of willful misconduct of a minor which results in the unauthorized destruction injury or defacement of the property of another or public property shall be imputed to the parent or guardian having custody of the minor a parent or guardian having custody of a minor convicted under the provisions of this section shall be liable for any fine assessed by the court any courtordered restoration of property and in addition thereto shall be liable to the city for any sum paid by the city as a reward as provided herein the parental responsibility imposed under this section shall be in addition to the liability imposed by florida statutes as amended f violation  penalty any person convicted of violating this section shall be punished by a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 each incident shall be considered a separate violation of this section in addition to such punishment the court may in imposing such sentence order the offender to restore the property so defaced damaged or destroyed g reward any person who provides information which leads to the arrest and conviction upon final appeal of any person for a violation under the provisions of this section and who testifies in the prosecution of the offender shall be eligible to receive a reward in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 except that no law enforcement officer of the city shall be eligible for such reward  3151989   181997   4152009 cross reference police training fees  141 speed limit reductioncypresshead development the city commission hereby reduces the tobacco in on or within one thousand 1000 feet of the real property comprising a public or private elementary middle or secondary school between the hours of  am and  midnight this section shall not apply to any person occupying a moving vehicle or within a private residence b enforcement and penalties 1 every police officer of the city may issue a citation to any person in violation of the provisions of this section any person issued a citation pursuant to this section shall be deemed to be charged with a civil infraction a fine of twentyfive dollars $2500 shall be assessed for each of herbal incense a definitions for the purpose of this section the following definition shall apply herbal incense shall mean aromatic plant material that is distributed in a loose leafy powder or granular form or in compressed blocks that can be easily crushed to result in a powder or granular form and can be placed into pipes cigarette papers or other drug paraphernalia for purposes of ingestion by smoking inhaling or other methods whether or not such product is labeled as not for human consumption synthetic stimulant bath salts shall mean any substance whether in powder crystal liquid tablet or capsule form containing a synthetic stimulant that can be ingested by smoking inhaling or other method regardless of whether the substance is marketed as not for the purpose of human consumption and regardless of how the substance is labeled including but not limited to bath salts insect repellant plant food herbs incense ipod cleaner nutrient dietary supplement or spice synthetic stimulant shall mean any chemical or mixture of chemicals however packaged that has a stimulant effect on the central nervous system packaging that indicates suggests or implies that a product mimics the pharmacological effects of cathinone methcathinone amphetamines methamphetamine cocaine ecstasy or any other substance listed in the controlled substance schedules in fs ch 893 or otherwise prohibited by federal or state law shall create a presumption that the product mimics the effects of the substance b sale or display prohibited it is unlawful for any person to sell offer for sale or display herbal incense or synthetic stimulant bath salts within the city limits of the city of parkland c penalties 1 any violation of the provisions of this section shall be punishable by a fine of up to five hundred dollars $50000 2 the city may also enforce the provisions of this section code enforcement process set forth within the city  9122012 hours of sale of alcohol limited hours of sale of alcoholic beverages no business shall offer for sale or sell any alcoholic beverages for consumption on or offpremises on any day between the hours of  pm and  am full service restaurants that apply for a special exception permit to operate beyond  pm may also apply for a special exception permit to offer for sale or sell alcoholic beverages during the extended operating hours so long as all food from the regular menu is prepared and offered for sale during the extended operating hours  542016 secs 11101114  reserved article ii  reserved footnotes  2  editors note of adopted oct 5 201
