enacted feb 9 198 did not expressly amend the   hence codification of  18 as herein set out in  11311138 was at the editors discretion compliance with article required it shall be unlawful for any person to keep bees or beehives within the city limits without following the prescription of this article  291983 exemptions the keeping of five 5 or less beehives on property owned by the beekeeper shall be exempt from this article  291983 permitrequired prior to any hive or bees being placed upon any property within the city the owner of said bees or beehive shall obtain from the city a permit  291983 sameprocedure  fee the following is the procedure for obtaining a permit 1 the owner of the beehives or the bees shall provide to the city clerk the following information a a written statement from the owner or owners agent of the property upon which the bees or beehives will be placed which states the legal description of the property the owner of the property that permission is given by the owner to have bees or beehives to be placed upon the property the length of time the permission is given and the number of hives to be placed upon the property b a log prepared by the beekeeper showing the number of hives to be placed upon the property c a sketch showing the location of each hive d the said log book shall be kept uptodate at all times and shall be open to inspection by the official of the city e a certificate from the department of agriculture and consumer service stating that the bees are not contagious or infectious 2 to pay for the expense of administering this article a permit fee shall be paid at the time the permit is applied for the cost shall be twentyfive dollars $2500 per location  291983 placement of beehives behind fence or hedge a beehives shall be placed behind a solid fence or hedge six 6 feet in height such hedges shall be placed in relationship to the hives to cause a flight line diversion so the bees come and go at a steep angle at the entrance of the hive b if this article is in conflict with any other ordinance regarding the height of fences or hedges this article shall prevail as it pertains to hedges or fences required in this article  291983 number of beehives in one location  distance requirements no more than sixty 60 beehives shall be located in any one 1 location location is defined as any place where one 1 to sixty 60 beehives are located locations must be at least one thousand 1000 feet apart locations shall not be within one thousand 1000 feet of any residence unless the owner of each residence within the one thousand 1000 feet signs a written statement waiving the onethousandfoot requirement  291983 adequate space in hives  hours bees may be manipulated a adequate space shall be maintained in each hive to prevent overcrowding and swarming b colonies shall be maintained in moveableframe hives at all times c hives of bees may not be manipulated between the hours of sunset and sunrise  291983 violations declared a nuisance any violation of this article is hereby declared to be a public nuisance and any person suffering injury or damage therefrom may seek the correction removal or abatement of such nuisance by securing injunctive relief  291983 reserved article iv  noise construction noise  prohibition no person shall operate or cause to be operated any equipment used in commercial or residential construction repair alteration or demolition work on buildings structures streets alleys or appurtenances thereto in residential or commercial land use categories or within three hundred 300 feet of such land use categories before  am and after  pm monday before  am and after  pm on saturday and before  am and after  pm on sundays and legal holidays this section does not apply to any land which is zoned agricultural or classified as agricultural on the citys land use plan or countys land use plan noise or construction equipment used in the performance of emergency work for the immediate safety health or welfare of individuals of the community or to restore property to a safe condition following a public calamity shall not be subject to the provisions of this section  6131984   611988   731996   522007   penalty for violation any person who is convicted of a violation of section 1140 by a court of competent jurisdiction shall be subject to a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or incarceration not to exceed ninety 90 days or both in the discretion of the county judge  6131984 continuous animal noise a generally between the hours of  pm and  am it shall be unlawful for any owner of a dog or other domesticated animal to permit said animal to bark or make other noises which because of their frequency and loudness would reasonably be expected to disturb persons residing in residentially zoned areas or areas which permit residential uses b violation  penalty each violation of this section shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 each separate incident shall be deemed a separate violation of this section punishable by the fine described herein  2 1221989 noise disturbance a the following acts are declared to be noise disturbances and shall constitute a violation of this chapter no sound level measurement is needed to prove the existence of the following noise disturbances 1 the sounding of any horn or signaling device except as a danger warning for any unnecessary or an excessive period of time or the unreasonable use of any horn or signaling device in such a loud and raucous manner as to disturb the peace health or comfort of a reasonable person of ordinary sensibilities 2 the operating or permitting the use or operation of any radio receiving set musical instrument television phonograph drum compact disc or tape player exterior loudspeaker or other device for the production or reproduction of sound in such a loud and raucous manner so as to disturb the peace quiet or comfort of the adjacent neighbor or operating any such device between the hours of  pm and  am in such a manner as to be plainly audible across property boundaries 3 the using operating or permitted to be used or operated of any loud speaker or public address system in such a loud and raucous manner which either annoys disturbs injures or endangers the peace health or comfort of a reasonable person or persons of ordinary sensibilities who are in the room vehicle or area in which such device is operated 4 the repairing rebuilding modifying or testing of any motor vehicle offroad vehicle racing vehicle or motor boat in or near a residential area in such a manner which either annoys disturbs injures or endangers the peace health or comfort of a reasonable person of ordinary sensibilities 5 the owning keeping possessing or harboring any animal bird or fowl which by frequent or habitual howling barking meowing squawking or other noisemaking so as to disturb the peace health or comfort of a reasonable person of ordinary sensibilities the provisions of this subsection shall also apply to all private or public facilities including any public or private facility which holds or treat animals but shall not apply to ae1 and ae2 zoning districts 6 the loading unloading compacting opening or otherwise handling boxes crates containers garbage cans or otherwise similar objects in such a manner so as to be plainly audible across property boundaries between the hours of  pm to  am on weekdays and between hours of  pm and  am on weekends and holidays unless otherwise addressed franchise agreement the loading unloading compacting opening or otherwise handling boxes crates containers garbage cans or otherwise similar objects in such a manner so as to cause excessive and unnecessary loud noises so as to disturb the peace health or comfort of a reasonable person of ordinary sensibilities 7 the operating or permitting the operation of any motor vehicle racing events at any place except an authorized track in a manner approved by the city manager 8 the operating or permitting the operation of powered model vehicles between the hours of  pm and  am maximum sound pressure levels during the permitted period of operation shall conform to those adopted by the city commission and set forth in the city shall be measured at the property boundary of the source or at a distance of fifty 50 feet if it is operated in a public place 9 the operating or causing the operation of any motorboat in any lake river stream or other waterway in such a manner so as to cause a noise disturbance 10 the operation of any vehicle for the purposes of collecting trash or garbage or recycled materials within the city between the hours of  pm and  am b alleged noise disturbance violations shall be investigated on a complaint only basis and only when the person or persons making the complaint contacts the city of parkland police department stating the details of the complaint and how the sound in question violates the provisions of this section otherwise the complaint shall not be investigated c the provisions contained in this section shall not affect the enforceability or the duty to comply with all other applicable provisions of the city d enforcement 1 the city may prosecute noise disturbance violations by issuance of a city ordinance citation in which case the penalty for a violation shall be as set out in the city 2 each day on which a violation exists shall constitute a separate violation 3 any violation of this ordinance shall constitute a nuisance the office of the city attorney may bring suit on behalf of the city or any affected citizen may bring suit in hisher name against the person or persons causing or maintaining the nuisance or against the owneragent of the building or property on which the nuisance exists relief may be granted according to the terms and conditions of florida statutes entitled abatement of nuisances  9182002   572003 noise regulation all terminology used in this article not defined below shall be in conformance with applicable publications of the american national standards institute ansi or its successor body 1 definitions the following words and terms when used in this section shall have the following meanings aweighting is the electronic filtering in sound level meters that models human hearing frequency sensitivity background sound level is the total sound pressure level in the area of interest excluding the noise source of interest commercial area is all property which is used primarily for the sale of merchandise or goods or for the performances of service or for office or clerical work construction is any site preparation assembly erection repair alteration or similar action or demolition of buildings or structures decibel db is the unit of measurement for sound pressure level at a specified location dba is the aweighted unit of sound pressure level emergency is any occurrence or set of circumstances involving actual or imminent physical trauma or property damage which demands immediate action emergency work is any work or action performed for the purpose of preventing or alleviating the physical trauma or property damage threatened or caused by an emergency impulsive sound is a sound having a duration of less than one 1 second with an abrupt onset and rapid decay industrial area is any property which is used primarily for manufacturing or processing legal holidays recognized by the city of parkland include new years day presidents day memorial day independence day labor day veterans day thanksgiving day day after thanksgiving and christmas day muffler a sounddissipative device or system for attenuating the sound of escaping gases of an internal combustion engine multifamily dwelling is any building or other shelter that has been divided into separate units to house more than one 1 family noise is any sound which annoys or disturbs humans or which causes or tends to cause any adverse psychological or physiological effect on humans noise disturbance is any sound that a endangers the safety or health of any person b disturbs a reasonable person of normal sensitivities or c endangers personal or real property octave band is all of the components in a sound spectrum whose frequencies are between two 2 sine waves components separated by an octave public space is any real property or structures thereon that is owned leased or controlled by a governmental entity real property line is the line including its vertical extension that separates one 1 parcel of real property from another residential area is all property on which people live and sleep or parks or hospitals or schools or nursing homes or that which is not commercial or industrial sound level meter slm is an instrument used to measure sound pressure levels conforming to type 1 or type 2 standards as specified in ansi standard s141983 or the latest version thereof sound pressure level spl is twenty 20 multiplied by the logarithm to the base ten 10 of the measured sound pressure divided by the sound pressure associated with the threshold of human hearing in units of decibels weekday is any day monday that is not a legal holiday 2 sound level limitations a no person shall cause suffer allow or permit the operation of any sound source in such a manner as to create a sound level that exceeds the sound level limits set forth in table 1 when measured at or within the real property line of the receiving property using the slow response setting unless otherwise noted such a sound source would constitute a noise disturbance table 1 sound level limits by receiving property receiving property category time sound level limit dba residential public space or institutional  am pm 60  pm am 55 commercial or business  am pm 65  pm am 60 industrial or manufacturing at all times 70 1 if the noise is an impulsive sound the fast response setting shall be used and the daytime  am pm limits of table 1 shall be increased by ten 10 dba 2 in a multifamily dwelling it shall be unlawful to create or permit to be created any noise that exceeds the daytime  am pm limit of fiftyfive 55 dba and the nighttime  pm am limit of fortyfive 45 dba as measured from a neighbors dwelling 3 in addition to the limits of table 1 and section 2a2 for any sound source which impacts residential public spaces or institutional property the maximum allowable sound level limits for the individual octave bands whose centers are sixtythree 63 one hundred twentyfive 125 two hundred fifty 250 and five hundred 500 hertz shall not exceed sixtyfive 65 db b the following are exempt from the sound level limits of section 2a 1 noise from emergency signaling devices  2 sound from church bells and chimes when a part of a religious observance or service  3 noise from landscape and yard equipment when operated between  am and  pm on weekdays and between  am and  pm on weekends and legal holidays provided all motorized equipment are equipped with functioning mufflers 3 exemptions a the provisions of this section shall not apply to 1 the generation of sound for the purpose of alerting persons to the existence of an emergency  2 the generation of sound in the performance of emergency work  or b noise generated from municipally sponsored or approved celebrations or events shall be exempt from the provisions of this section 4 enforcement procedures a the city of parkland may prosecute noise related violations by issuance of a city ordinance citation in which case the penalty for a violation shall be a fine of up to five hundred dollars $50000 if the violation is of a continuing nature each day during which it occurs shall constitute a separate violation b in lieu of issuing a fine as provided in subsection 4a the certified code enforcement officer or police officer of the city of parkland may issue an order requiring immediate abatement of any sound source alleged to be in violation of this section c no provision of this section shall be construed to impair any common law or statutory cause of action or legal remedy therefrom of any person for injury or damage arising from any violation of this section or from other law  9182002 secs 11451152  reserved article v  open burning footnotes  4  editors note inasmuch as adopted  enacted provisions designated and codified as art iv  1140 1141 the editor has redesignated the provisions of  adopted  as art v  11531158 to read as herein set forth declaration of intent the city commission finds and declares that the open burning of materials outdoors and the use of outdoor heating devices result in or contribute to air pollution the city commission further finds that regulation of open burning and outdoor heating devices will significantly reduce air pollution it is the intent of the city to require that licensed open burning be conducted in a manner under conditions and within certain time periods that will reduce or eliminate the deleterious and noisome effects of air pollution caused by open burning  6211984 definitions when used in this article the following words phrases and terms shall have the indicated meanings unless the context clearly indicates otherwise 1 agricultural burning is the burning of vegetative material originating with the cultivation of an indefinite quantity of land and including gardening or horticulture fruit growing raising of vegetables trees shrubs plants and similar products 2 air pollution means the presence in the outdoor atmosphere of any one 1 or more substances or contaminants in quantities which are or may be potentially harmful or injurious to human health or welfare or plant life or property or unreasonably interferes with the enjoyment of life or property including outdoor recreation 3 approved fuel means fuel approved by the city to emit or release a minimum of pollutants when burned 4 excessive visible emissions means air pollutants emitted in such quantity as to obscure an observers view to a degree equal to or greater than forty 40 percent opacity 5 extinguished means the absence of any visible flames smoke or emissions 6 garbage means all kitchen and table food waste animal or vegetative waste that is attendant with or results from the storage packaging preparation cooking or handling of food material 7 landclearing operation means the uprooting or clearing of vegetation in connection with construction for buildings and rightsofway mineral operations control of weeds or enhancement of property value however it does not include the maintenance burning of yard trash resulting from fallen limbs branches or leaves or any other routine residential property cleanup activities or site preparation 8 occupied building is any building that serves as a primary residence meeting place or place of business that does not have a lengthy cessation of occupancy 9 opacity means a condition which renders material partially or wholly impervious to rays of light causing obstruction of observers view 10 open burning means any outdoor fire or combustion which produces or may produce air pollution and which is used outdoors for the purpose of giving protection from cold or frost 11 outdoor heating device means any apparatus machine equipment or other contrivance in which is burned any type of fuel capable of producing air pollution 12 prescribed burning is the controlled application of fire to naturally occurring vegetation under specified environmental conditions and following appropriate precautionary measures which causes the fire to be confined to a predetermined area and accomplished planned land management objectives 13 rural land means land which is actually used for agricultural activities and is not residential land zoned ae1 or ae2 for the purposes of this article is not rural land 14 sunset means official sunset as set forth by the us naval observatory 15 trash means construction or demolition debris and other debris such as paper cardboard cloth glass street sweepings vehicle tires and other like matter 16 yard trash means vegetative matter resulting from landscaping and yard maintenance operations and includes materials such as tree and shrub trimmings grass clippings palm fronds trees and tree stumps  6211984   10192005 prohibitions a general prohibitions any open burning not specifically allowed by this article is prohibited no person shall ignite cause to be ignited permit to be ignited suffer allow burn or maintain any prohibited open burning the florida division of forestry fdf or any authorized fire control agency empowered by law or ordinance to extinguish unlawful burning may extinguish or cause to be extinguished any fire that is unauthorized or does not comply with this section any person responsible for unlawful open burning shall bear any applicable costs involved in extinguishing the fire b distance from occupied buildings no open burning will be allowed unless it is a minimum of three hundred 300 feet distant from any occupied building a waiver will be given if permission in writing is obtained from the occupant of said building c distance from public highway no open burning will be allowed unless it is a minimum of one hundred fifty 150 feet distant from any public highway measured from the material to be burned to the centerline of the highway d time period no open burning will be allowed before  am or later than one 1 hour before sunset no burning is permitted on weekends and legal holidays e hazard to air traffic no open burning will be allowed which causes or constitutes a hazard to air traffic f land clearing operations no open burning will be allowed for the purpose of landclearing operations g no open burning will be allowed to reduce yard trash and household paper products generated on occupied residential premises h no open burning will be allowed for tires rubber material bunker c residual oil asphalt roofing material tar railroad cross ties other creosoted lumber plastics garbage or yard trash i no open burning will be allowed for waste pesticide containers j no open burning will be allowed for waste material generated by demolition of a structure k any open burning that is permitted by this article is restricted to the site where the material was generated and may not be transported offsite to another property to be open burned except landclearing debris that is generated by the commercial landclearing activities of a person may be transported offsite to be burned by an air curtain incinerator that is owned or operated by that person with an appropriate broward county department of planning and environmental protection dpep air operation license l any open burning not specifically permitted herein is prohibited  6211984   10192005 license required for allowable open burning 1 permit required in addition to any permit required by any other governmental entity all open burning within the city is hereby prohibited unless conducted under a permit issued by the development services department 2 application required any person desiring to conduct open burning within the city shall first submit an application to the development services department which shall include the following information a name and address of applicant  b status of applicant corporation individual partnership  c name and address of officer or principal acting as representative for applicant  d location of open burning attach sketch and location map  e purpose of open burning  f commencement date and completion date of open burning and actual number of days of open burning  g type of business or activity involved  h whether air curtain incinerator will be utilized during open burning  i approximate distance to nearest public rightsofway from the location of the burning site and distance to any occupied building from the legal boundary of the property on which open burning will take place j description of proposed equipment to be kept onsite including equipment to extinguish a fire immediately and operating practices the type quantity composition and amount of air contaminants to be released to the atmosphere  k reason why no method other than open burning is feasible  l a copy of the landclearing contractors county license and affidavit stating that all burning permitted shall be conducted under hisher direct supervision the landclearing contractor shall be on site during all burning operations m any required approvals or permits from the florida department of environmental regulation fdf dpep or any other governmental agency with jurisdiction shall be submitted with the application for permit 3 application review all applications for open burning permits submitted shall be reviewed by the planning and zoning department environmental services department and fire department an open burning permit shall be issued for the following reasons only a for the instruction and training of organized fire fighters under the supervision of an appropriate fire control official  b fires necessary for the purposes of disease and pest prevention as well as the prevention of a fire hazard as determined by the fdf and the fire chief shall not be conducted without a permit license which shall be issued to the fire control agency which will supervise such activity  c prescribed burning necessary for the purposes of precautionary measures  d fires from established organizations for recreational or ceremonial purposes such as but not limited to functions for girl or boy scout troops church groups organized youth groups or other similar activities or rural land clearing purposes  and e open burning will be allowed for agricultural purposes when approved by the florida division of forestry florida department of agriculture and the fire department the only properties eligible for agricultural burn permits are those that are classified by the broward county property appraiser as bona fide agricultural land under the agricultural assessment provisions of fs   and are over two 2 acres in size all other properties are prohibited from obtaining agricultural burn permits the fire chief shall have the discretion to deny the application if in hisher opinion the open burning activities are of such a unique character and nature so as to pose an unreasonable risk danger and hazard to the health safety and welfare of the residents of the city if the application is denied by either the development services department or fire chief the applicant may appeal to the city commission within five 5 business days for review of the staffs recommendations 4 fee schedule all open burning permit applicants shall pay the following fees prior to issuance of the permit a one hundred dollars $10000 per acre of area to be cleared  b two hundred dollars $20000 per day of open burning per acre to be cleared shall mean the acreage of property that will actually be cleared not the total acreage of the subject parcel  and c no fee will be charged for licenses for training burns ceremonial recreational and fires necessary for disease or pest prevention as determined by the fdf and the fire chief 5 daily notice of a proposed burn shall be given to the fire department no burning shall commence without a minimum of twentyfour 24 hours advance notice to the fire chief the fire chief shall have the authority to a delay the ignition of all burning  b order the extinguishment of burning  c order any other action deemed necessary to ensure the burning does not create a hazard 6 the permit issued under this section shall be limited to sixty 60 days the city may extend the term of the permit for up to thirty 30 days in the event delays were caused by citys action and that no change in the open burning activity occurred a valid environmental quality control board permit shall be in effect for the original term and any extension thereof however once issued any permit is subject to revocation upon receipt of one 1 valid complaint the validity of a complaint is determined by the fire officer who responds to the burn site or area affected by a complaint  6211984   10192005 exemptions 1 open burning will be allowed for the outdoor noncommercial preparation of food in a stove oven barbecue pit or fireplace for the purpose of cooking provided the fire is properly contained and is not used to burn yard waste house refuse garbage recyclable materials or commercial debris 2 open burning will be allowed when any outdoor heating device using approved fuel is used for the purposes of frost protection 3 open burning will be allowed for the flaring of waste gases for reasons of safety as long as excessive visible emissions do not exceed the allowable limitations 4 open burning will be allowed for agricultural purposes on properties over one hundred 100 acres when approved by the florida division of forestry florida department of agriculture and the fire department the only properties eligible for exempted agricultural burn are those that are classified by the broward county property appraiser as bona fide agricultural land under the agricultural assessment provisions of fs   5 open burning will be allowed for firefighting training by a recognized fire department 6 open burning will be allowed to the girl scouts camp camp telogia in approved pits  6211984   10192005  a  2 4152009 penalty any person who violates the provisions of this article shall after conviction by a court of competent jurisdiction be liable for a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisonment for not more than ninety 90 days or both in the discretion of the county judge  6211984 reserved article vi  false alarms footnotes  5  editors note  adopted dec 5 200 amended the former art vi  11601168 and enacted a new art vi as set out herein the former art vi pertained to similar subject matter for complete derivation see the table at the end of this volume definitions a alarm system means any mechanical or electrical device which is designed or used for the detection of an unauthorized entry into a building structure facility or enclosed area or for alerting others of the commission of an unlawful act within a building structure facility or enclosed area or both and which is designed to emit an audible siren andor alert a monitoring party of either the unauthorized entry into the property  a medical emergency  the presence of a fire  or other emergency requiring the assistance of law enforcement fire department or emergency medical personnel alarm systems include but are not limited to telephone alarm devices audible alarms and proprietor alarms excluded from the definition of alarm systems are devices which are not designed or used to register alarms that are audible visible or perceptible outside of the protected building structure facility or enclosed area  or auxiliary devices installed by telephone companies to protect telephone systems from damage or disruption of service b audible alarm means a device designed for the detection of unauthorized entry or premises andor a medical emergency  the presence of a fire  or other emergency requiring the assistance of law enforcement fire department or emergency medical personnel which generates an audible sound when it is activated c city means parkland florida d alarm signal means the audible sound or a transmission of a signal or a message as the result of the activation of an alarm system or an audible alarm e false alarm means the activation of an alarm systems audible siren andor the notification of a monitoring party when there is no unauthorized entry into the property  there is no medical emergency  there is no fire  and there is no other emergency requiring law enforcement fire or medical personnel failure malfunction improper installation or the negligence of the owner or lessee of an alarm system or of his employees or agents such terminology does not include for example alarms caused by hurricanes tornados earthquakes or other violent conditions f notice unless otherwise specified means written notice given either by certified mail return receipt requested by personal service upon the addressee or posted on the property g person means any natural person or individual or any firm partnership association limited partnership sole proprietorship or corporation or any business entity whatsoever h law enforcement officer means any member of the public safety department or its designee authorized to enforce all criminal and traffic laws and ordinances within the city i telephone alarm device means any device which when activated automatically transmits by telephone line a recorded alarm message or electronic or mechanical alarm signal to any telephone instrument installed at a law enforcement office or to any telephone instrument installed at a facility as part of the 911 system j alarm business means any person engaged in the selling leasing installing maintaining or servicing of alarm systems who sells leases installs maintains or services alarm systems located within the city limits k alarm user means any person business firm partnership corporation association organization company or other entity deemed by the city to be an alarm user that possesses andor uses andor operates an alarm system within the city limits l excessive false alarms means a third or subsequent false alarm occurring during the calendar year which was not caused by extreme weather conditions  1252007  e  2 4152009 false alarm fees a false alarms 1 first three false alarms free of charge 2 fourth false alarm  $10000 3 fifth and above false alarms  25000 b failure to pay within thirty 30 days service fee each  3500  1252007 prohibition of certain telephone alarm devices a except for telephone alarm devices utilized by governmental units or agencies it is unlawful for any person firm corporation or association to install maintain own possess operate or use any telephone alarm device regulated or programmed to make connection with 1 any telephone or telephone line installed in any facility of any law enforcement office  2 any telephone or telephone line installed in any facility as part of the 911 system b telephone alarm devices are permitted when not connected directly to a law enforcement office or any facility as part of the 911 system but they are subject to all other provisions of this article c any alarm system which automatically telephones a law enforcement agency over telephone lines exclusively used by the public or request emergency services or information d any alarm systems which do not have an auxiliary power supply which activates in the event of power failure or electrical outage  1252007 removal of unlawful systems the law enforcement officer when there is probable cause to believe that there has been a violation of section 1162a1 or 2 of this article shall order the owner operator or lessee to disconnect and cease operation of the system within seventytwo 72 hours of receipt of the order notice shall be by personal service if personal service cannot be made notice shall be by certified mail return receipt requested any telephone alarm device installed prior to the effective date of the ordinance from which this article is derived shall have been removed within thirty 30 days of such date it shall be unlawful for any person as defined in this article to fail to comply with the provisions of the article  1252007 deactivation of audible alarms within thirty minutes it is unlawful to maintain any alarm system or audible alarm that does not deactivate within thirty 30 minutes of its activation  1252007 intentional activation of alarms prohibited if no emergency exists it is unlawful for any person to intentionally activate any alarm system or audible alarm except in the event of an actual or attempted felony misdemeanor fire or medical emergency or to periodically test the alarm equipment after giving advance notice to the law enforcement officer  1252007 false alarms for a law enforcement agency fire department or emergency medical personnel response to an incident of a false alarm as the result of the activation of any alarm system or audible alarm the following fees and procedures shall apply 1 for a response to premises at which no other false alarm has occurred within the preceding six 6 months no fee shall be charged  but the person having or maintaining the alarm system or audible alarm shall within three 3 working days after notice to do so complete a written report to the law enforcement officer on forms prescribed by the law enforcement officer setting forth the cause of the false alarm if known  the corrective action taken  whether the alarm system has been inspected by a licensed alarm service company and such other information as the law enforcement officer may reasonably require to determine the cause of such false alarm and the necessary corrective action 2 no fee for a second or third response to premises within six 6 months after a first response shall be charged  the law enforcement officer shall be authorized to cause the alarm system at the premises to be inspected during reasonable hours by an independent alarm service company or a duly authorized agent of the law enforcement office with a written report furnished to the law enforcement officer by the inspector within seventytwo 72 hours written notice shall be either issued to an adult occupant of the residence structure or building or if no such person is available shall be left in a prominent place at the residence structure or building the law enforcement officer shall prescribe necessary corrective action and shall give notice to the person having or maintaining the alarm system of the conditions and requirements of this article all costs of such inspections including the alarm service companys fee shall be paid by the person who owns or maintains the alarm system or audible alarm as the case may be 3 for a fourth response to premises by citys law enforcement agency fire department or emergency medical personnel within twelve 12 months after a third response as described in subsection 2 above and for all succeeding responses within six 6 months of the most recent response a fee of one hundred dollars $10000 shall be charged and if the fourth false alarm of any succeeding false alarm has resulted from the failure to take any corrective action prescribed by the law enforcement officer the law enforcement officer may serve a written notice upon the person owning or maintaining such audible alarm or alarm system ordering the disconnection of such alarm system or audible alarm it shall be unlawful for the person owning or maintaining such alarm system or audible alarm to fail to disconnect such alarm system upon order to the law enforcement officer and it shall further be unlawful to reconnect said alarm system or audible alarm until the prescribed corrective action has been taken  provided however that no alarm system or audible alarm shall be disconnected where such alarm system or audible alarm is situated in any premises required by law to have such alarm system or audible alarm in operation 4 an alarm that has been ordered by the law enforcement officer to be disconnected may be reconnected upon satisfactory proof submitted to the law enforcement officer that the prescribed corrective action has been taken 5 notice of a false alarm shall be by personal service if personal service cannot be made notice shall be by registered mail return receipt requested or posted on the property the citys law enforcement agency fire department and emergency medical personnel shall provide the city with a copy of each false alarm notice issued notice shall be in essentially the following form you are hereby notified that you have violated parkland ordinances which prohibits certain false alarms this is your ___________ violation of the ordinance previous violations occurred on ___________ dates ___________ the most recent violation occurred on ___________ date ___________ at ___________ address ___________ at ___________ time within three 3 days of receipt of this notice you are required to submit a written report setting forth the cause of the false alarm if known the corrective action taken and whether the alarm system has been inspected by an alarm service company as this is the ___________ false alarm over a ___________ month period you are not subject to a fine of one hundred dollars $10000 furthermore if there has been more than one 1 false alarm within the past six 6 months your alarm system is subject to inspection at your expense by an independent alarm service company or by this department violations of the terms of the parkland ordinances may cause your alarm system to be disconnected and may subject you to a fine incarceration or both  1252007 exception for new installations all newly installed alarm systems shall be exempt from the regulations of section 1166 above inorder to allow alarm installers and users to adjust the system new installations shall be subject to the regulations of section 1166 above thirty 30 days after installation is complete  1252007 penalties violation of the provisions and prohibitions of this article shall constitute an offense and violation of a city ordinance any person who is convicted of a violation by a court of competent jurisdiction shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment in the county jail not to exceed sixty 60 days or by both such fine and imprisonment  1252007 article vii  park regulations footnotes  6  editors note pursuant to instructions by the city  adopted dec 6 198 has been codified herein as art vii  11691177 cross reference contained herein shall apply to all city parks as follows a state law all applicable provisions of laws and rules regulating the equipment and operation of motor vehicles on florida highways will be strictly enforced in the parks together with such rules provided in this article b directions of traffic all traffic officers and designated park employees are authorized and instructed to direct traffic whenever and whenever needed in the parks and on the highways streets or roads immediately adjacent thereto in accordance with the provisions of this article and such supplementary rules as may be issued by the division or other state agency no person shall fail to comply with any lawful order signal or direction of such officer or employee all persons shall observe carefully all traffic signs indicating speed direction caution stopping or parking and all others posted for proper control and to safeguard life and property c speed of vehicles in parks no person shall drive a vehicle at a speed exceeding ten 10 miles per hour d restriction to roads no person shall drive any motorized vehicle on any area except park roads or parking areas or such other areas as are designated as temporary parking areas e parking 1 all motor cars shall be parked only in established and indicated parking areas or in such other areas and at such times as may be designated 2 full parking on roads or driveways is forbidden at all times except in an emergency 3 no person shall park or station any vehicle in any zone designated and marked no parking or otherwise marked for restricted use except briefly for the expeditious loading or unloading of passengers or freight 4 no person shall make nonemergency repairs perform routine maintenance or wash any vehicle in any city park or recreation area 5 no vehicles are permitted to remain in a parking area after closing hours any vehicle parked continuously in the park for in excess of twentyfour 24 hours will be towed at the owners expense f bicycles bicycles may be ridden on any designated roads or trails when riding vehicular roads they must observe all safety rules and regulations as constituted by state law bicyclists shall when riding or parking their bikes respect the safety and security of other park users g prohibited areas all wheeled vehicles are prohibited from all tennis and basketball courts but may be ridden on any designated road or trail h penalty the penalty for violation of this section shall be twentyfive dollars $2500 for each incident i enforcement violations of this section may be enforced by issuance of a citation as provided in chapter 20 of this by any other means permitted by law  1261989   871991   171998   10202004 park property the restrictions and regulations contained herein shall apply to all city parks as follows a buildings and other property no person shall willfully mark deface or injure in any way or displace remove or tamper with any park buildings bridges tables benches fireplaces railings paving or paving material waterlines or public utilities or parts or appurtenances thereof park signs notices or placards whether temporary or permanent monuments stakes posts or other boundary markers or other structures or equipment facilities or park property or appurtenances whatsoever either real or personal b trees shrubbery lawns etc trees shrubbery lawns etc are property assets of the park  and no person shall cut carve or injure the bark or break off limbs or branches or mutilate in any way or pick the flowers or seeds of any tree or plant  nor shall any person dig in or otherwise disturb grass areas or in any other way injure or impair the natural beauty or usefulness of any area  nor shall he pile debris or material of any kind on or about any tree or plat or attach any rope wire or other contrivance thereto whether temporary or permanent in character or use c wild animals birds etc no person shall molest harm frighten kill trap hunt chase capture shoot or throw missiles at any mammal bird reptile or amphibian  nor shall he remove or have in his possession the young of any wild animal or the eggs nests or young of any reptile or bird  1261989   871991 recreational activities and facilities the restrictions and regulations contained herein shall apply to all city parks as follows a tents no person shall erect maintain use or occupy in any area any tent canopy shelter or structure of any kind within a city park with the exception of a temporary sunshade canopy 1 temporary sunshade canopies shall be defined as not exceeding ten 10 feet by ten 10 feet in size open sided containing no hanging items and must be securely fashioned to the ground use of tent stakes in each leg 2 no person shall erect a temporary sunshade canopy earlier than thirty 30 minutes prior to scheduled activity start times and must be removed within thirty 30 minutes following the activity 3 placement of temporary sunshade canopies is limited to the sidelines of athletic fields during officially scheduled cityrecognized events 4 placement of temporary sunshade canopies may not impede the visibility of other spectators as determined by the leisure services director or hisher designee 5 temporary sunshade canopies shall not be attached to another temporary sunshade canopy and shall not placed next to permanent or temporary structures b fires 1 no person shall start or maintain any outdoor fire except in designated areas fires shall be limited to cooking on picnic grills no ground fires shall be permitted 2 cooking fires shall be started and maintained only in a stove fireplace or barbecue pit maintained by the parks department fuels used in cooking fires shall not produce any noxious fumes or smoke 3 no person starting or maintaining any fire in a park shall leave the area without first extinguishing the fire 4 special events cooking permits may be obtained from the city c camping no person shall set up tents shacks or any other temporary shelter or bring in any recreational vehicle for the purpose of camping camping shall be prohibited in city parks d horseback riding horses are not permitted on any ballfield or play area of a park horses shall not go unattended e photography no person shall take still or motion pictures for commercial purposes involving the use of special settings or structures or the performance of a cast or persons either amateur or professional without first obtaining written permission from the city commission or its designee otherwise there shall be no restriction on photographic activities f permits the city commission or its designee may upon written application grant specific use permits for special uses when in the opinion of the city commission special consideration is warranted g fees and charges the city commission may determine and fix by resolution such fees and charges for services and activities made available in city parks h swimming no person in a park shall swim or bathe in any waterway that is in or adjacent to any park i fishing no person shall engage in fishing at any location where such activity is prohibited unless such activity has been approved via a special events permit j launching of boats jet skis radiocontrolled or other water vehicles from any city property it shall be illegal and a violation of this section for any person to launch or propel from any city property or the shoreline adjacent to any city property a boat a jet ski or any other similar type water vehicle into the waters adjacent k playground rules individuals shall adhere to all posted playground rules l remote controlled vehicles or drones remote controlled vehicles or drones are not permitted within any city park m golf no person shall strike a golf ball within any city park unless such activity is part of a cityauthorized program  1261989   871991   171998   4182007  b  2 4152009   772010   322016 hours of operation the restrictions and regulations contained herein shall apply to all city parks as follows parks will be open as posted including hours of operation any section or part of any park may be declared closed to the public at any time or limited to certain users or times as public interest demands or safety and security indicates at the discretion of the parks  1261989   871991 nuisances the restrictions and regulations contained herein shall apply to all city parks as follows a intoxicating beverages drinking possession of or bringing alcoholic beverages into any city park is prohibited except during a special event conducted and authorized by the city b fireworks and explosives possessing exploding discharging or burning within or bringing into any park area any fireworks or other potentially dangerous inflammable material including model rockets is prohibited except during a special event conducted and authorized by the city c domestic animals domestic animals shall be excluded from all city parks except the parkland equestrian center at temple park domestic animals may run freely provided they are under human control at the parkland equestrian center at temple park except during special events d public nuisance and disorderly conduct whoever commits such acts as are of a nature to corrupt the public morals or outrage the sense of public decency or affect the peace and quiet of persons who may witness them or engages in brawling or fighting or engages in such conduct as to constitute a hazard to the health safety or welfare of other park visitors shall upon due notice of violation be classed as a trespasser and ordered to leave the park by any authorized city representative e city buildings or pavilion no hoofed animals shall be permitted in or upon city buildings or the pavilion located at the parkland equestrian center at temple park  1261989   871991   851992   1111995   962006  c  2 4152009   1052011 merchandising advertising and signs the restrictions and regulations any public rightofway or public property  provided that such sale shall be permitted for authorized city concessionaires operating pursuant to a contract with the city or by special permit issued by exceed five hundred dollars $50000  1261989 smoking prohibited in outdoor areas in city parks 1 it shall be unlawful for any person to smoke or chew tobacco on the grounds of any public park operated by the city of parkland 2 a law enforcement officer may issue a citation to any person in violation of the provisions of this section 3 penalty any person issued a citation pursuant to this section shall be deemed to be charged with a civil infraction a fine of twentyfive $2500 shall be assessed for each violation of this section 4 this section shall not apply to any person smoking within a motor vehicle that is within a city park whether or not located in a parking lot  322005 dog park regulations the dog park known as barkland is an unsupervised facility and users enter at their own risk by entering this facility owners expressly understand and accept that the city is not responsible for any and all damages which may be caused by their dog or other dogs owners and those with custody of a dog are legally responsible for their dogs and any injury they may cause and for complying with the following regulations while in the park a barkland is open daily from  am to sunset all persons and dogs must vacate the park when it is not open b all dogs must have current rabies shots and a current rabies tag and license displayed on their collar or harness at all times c all dog waste must be disposed of immediately and completely d if a dog becomes aggressive or is provoking others it must be removed from the park immediately e owners or those with custody of a dog must be with the dog at all times and may bring a maximum of two 2 dogs per person per visit f dogs must have a collar and be held by a leash when entering or exiting the park dog owners or those with custody of a dog must carry a leash for each dog in their care while in the park g dogs that are in heat or sick are not allowed in the park h no animals other than dogs are permitted i puppies under four 4 months of age are not permitted in the park j children under the age of twelve 12 must be supervised by an adult at all times k if a dog digs the owner or person with custody of a dog is responsible for stopping its behavior and refilling the area l no food treats alcoholic beverages soft drinks and water are allowed strollers bicycles or childrens toys are allowed in the dog park m choke prong pinch and spike collars are not allowed in the park n professional dog trainers are not permitted to use this facility for training o dog pools are prohibited p use of this facility shall be for a dog park  any other use is prohibited q all dog bites or injuries must be reported to a park ranger park rangers can be reached by calling 954 9130496 dogs andor their owners or those with custody of a dog who violate these rules are subject to removal from the park and possible suspension of the right to use the park the city reserves the right to refuse entry to dogs andor their owners into barkland for the reasons of health safety and prior offenses or for the comfort of all patrons andor their pets 1179 212012 editors note  adopted sept 14 200 repealed  1179 which pertained to helmets checks in organized sport a all cityrecognized sports organizations that utilize any city facility court or playing field shall be required to comply with the standards and requirements of this section the local level governing board of each cityrecognized sports organization shall be required to certify compliance with this requirement as set forth herein this shall be a condition of the authorized use of the fields by the particular cityrecognized sports organization governed by the local level of governing board the city manager or hisher designee is hereby authorized and directed to prohibit any cityrecognized sports organization which does not comply with these requirements from utilizing any city facility court or playing field b the city hereby adopts the following criteria for exclusion of adult managers coaches and any other person eighteen 18 years of age or older who has any supervisory or coaching responsibility regardless of title or designation including league board members and buddy volunteers hereinafter referred to as volunteer any volunteer shall be disqualified from participating as a volunteer on cityowned fields if the person has been found guilty of any one 1 of the following crimes guilty means that a person was found guilty following a trial entered a guilty plea entered a no contest plea accompanied by a court finding of guilty regardless of whether there was an adjudication of guilt or a withholding of guilt sex offenses all sex offenses regardless of the amount of time since the offense examples include child molestation rape sexual assault sexual battery sodomy prostitution solicitation indecent exposure or similar offenses felonies all felony offenses involving violence regardless of the amount of time since the offense all felony offenses other than violence or sexual offenses within the past ten 10 years misdemeanors all misdemeanor violent offenses within the past seven 7 years examples include simple assault battery domestic violence hit and run and similar offenses all misdemeanor drug and alcohol offenses within the past five 5 years or multiple offenses within the past ten 10 years examples include driving under the influence simple drug possession drunk and disorderly conduct public intoxication possession of drug paraphernalia and similar offenses any other misdemeanor within the past five 5 years that would be considered a potential danger to children or is directly related to the functions of that volunteer contributing to the delinquency of a minor providing alcohol to a minor theft if person is handling monies and related offenses the city further finds that any volunteer who has been charged with any of the disqualifying offenses above with cases pending in court should not be permitted to volunteer until the official adjudication of the case c the city adopts the standards of the association for screening of volunteers the city shall require all volunteers to be screened for the above recommended exclusionary criteria once a year as of   cityrecognized sports organizations already in season as of  will be exempt until the season commencing after  background checks shall be valid from july 1 to june 30 annually d all cityrecognized sports organizations that utilize any city facility court or playing field shall be required to provide the names of all volunteers and the payment of a fee established by the city manager for each volunteer so that the city may undertake the required background screening to determine if the volunteers should be excluded based upon the abovestated criteria no volunteer shall be permitted to participate in the activities of a cityrecognized sports organization until the city has received the results of the background check and a finding has been made that the volunteer is not disqualified the city shall make arrangements with a qualified entity to undertake the background screening the city manager shall authorize an approved set of forms to implement the requirements of this section  all cityrecognized sports organizations shall supply the information required by the form as a requirement of this section the standards as set forth in this section shall be applied by the background screening entity the background screening entity shall undertake the background screening and provide the results to the city the results shall be simply a statement of whether the specific volunteer satisfies the criteria or should be excluded by failing to satisfy the criteria set forth above if the determination by the background screening entity contracted by the city is that the volunteer does not meet the criteria set forth herein then the city shall provide said notice to the cityrecognized sports organizations and the volunteer shall not be permitted to participate in any cityrecognized sports organization activity on any city facility court or playing field as a manager coach supervisor or assistant all cityrecognized sports organizations using any city facility court or playing field shall comply with these requirements and shall not permit any volunteer who has not satisfied the exclusionary criteria to participate in violation of this section e the sports policy of the city as set forth in resolution no 200742a shall be amended to include this section f upon receiving results of background screenings from the city each cityrecognized sports organization shall notify its participants of all coaches who have been approved though the screening process  1012008   11182009 is owned or leased by a corporation and said corporation has adopted a company decal or insignia the corporation may display the corporate decal or insignia in lieu of a and b above 2 the above information shall be in bold letters and numerals at least two 2 inches high distinctly contrasting in color with the background and permanently affixed to the vehicle in such a manner as to be footnotes  8  editors note pursuant to instructions by the city adopted feb 7 199 has been codified herein as art ix  and the provisions of  19 and 12 of said ordinance have been designated by the editor as  11861195   10 and 11 repealer and severability respectively have not been codified herein division 1  generally definitions for the purposes of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein when not inconsistent with the context words used in the present tense include the future  words in the plural include the singular  and words in the singular include the plural the word shall is always mandatory and not merely directory city the city of parkland florida district the south florida water management district sfwmd or the district emergency a situation where plans implemented in response to a water shortage are insufficient to protect the public health safety or welfare including fire protection for human and animal life and real properties fish or aquatic life a public water supply or recreational commercial industrial agricultural or other reasonable uses person any person firm partnership association corporation company or organization of any kind water shortage when insufficient water is available to meet the requirements of the south florida water management district permit system  or when conditions are such as to require temporary reduction in total use within the area to protect water resources from serious harm  or when it is determined that a public water system has become seriously affected by lack of plant capacity to treat water demanded saltwater intrusion lack of water pressure due to mechanical failure or lack of supply  or where the sfwmd declares an emergency related to a water shortage  or where sufficient water is not available to meet present or anticipated needs for persons using the water resource  or any other manifestation of insufficient water availability  271990   662007  d  2 4152009 jurisdiction the provisions of this article apply to all persons using water within the corporate limits of the city when the city or sfwmd declares a water shortage or water shortage emergency  271990   662007 application of article a water conservation measures shall be invoked by the city commission by resolution where 1 the sfwmd determines and declares a water shortage or determines that a water shortage emergency exists within a geographical area that includes the city  or 2 the city commission determines by resolution that a reduction in water consumption is necessary said resolution of the city commission shall be reduced to writing and shall designate the items of section 1189 below which shall be included in the restrictions or curtailment to the extent necessary to alleviate the specific water shortage or water shortage emergency b where the city commission declares that a reduction in consumption is necessary pursuant to subsection a2 above the regulations promulgated pursuant to such resolution see section 1189 below shall apply to all city consumers of water  271990   662007 conservation measures upon a determination that a water shortage condition exists the city commission may order the restriction or curtailment of the use of water to the extent necessary to alleviate the water shortage condition and may implement any or all of the following 1 restricted uses uses of water to be restricted or curtailed include but are not limited to the following a the sprinkling watering or irrigating of shrubbery trees lawns grass ground covers plants vines gardens vegetables including the specification of certain days hours or periods of time as well as place limitations when lawns and shrubbery may be watered b the washing of automobiles trucks trailers railroad cars mobile homes campers boats or any other type of mobile equipment c the washing of sidewalks driveways filling station aprons porches exteriors of homes apartments or other outdoor surfaces d the operation of any ornamental fountain or other structure using water with or without a recirculating system e the operation of airconditioning without a recirculation system f swimming and wading pools not using a filter and recirculating system g the escape of water plumbing which means to knowingly allow water to escape system that is in disrepair h hotels motels and restaurants shall be restricted to the minimum amount of water necessary to conduct operations and shall curtail or prohibit any use of water including but not limited to the use of water to serve a customer in a restaurant unless requested by a customer i miscellaneous uses of water from hydrants for construction purposes fire drills dust control or any purpose other than firefighting j other restrictions required by the sfwmd shall be applicable to the use of water in the city 2 additionally all restrictions as declared by sfwmd which are applicable to the city shall immediately be effective in the city and any violation of these restrictions shall be a violation of this article 3 extension of water service a restriction on applications to begin a new use or modify an existing use requiring water service connections meters service lines pipeline extensions mains or other water service facilities  271990   662007 reserved editors note  adopted  repealed  1190 which pertained to basis for conservation measures and derived from  adopted feb 7 1990 daily restrictions the south florida water management district restrictions shall be the restrictions for all water consumers in the city unless specified otherwise and all provisions of florida administrative as amended from time to time shall be applicable to the city any violation of that any rule or order promulgated by the sfwmd shall be a violation of this article  271990   662007 exception to maintain sanitation the city commission upon the recommendation of the broward county health department or department of environmental regulation or upon its own recognizance shall have the authority to permit a reasonable use of water in any case necessary to maintain adequate health and sanitation standards a letter from the appropriate agency to the city shall be required to permit such reasonable use of water during a water shortage or water shortage emergency situation  271990 water users to accept provisions of article no water service shall be furnished to any person in the city unless that person agrees to accept all the provisions contained in this article the acceptance of water service from the city shall be in itself the acceptance of the provisions thereof  271990 enforcement by police officers every police officer of the city shall in connection with his duties imposed by law diligently enforce the provisions of this article  271990 penalties violation of any provision of this article shall be subject to the following penalties a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 per incident  city resolution no 200758 is hereby incorporated to provide a graduated scale of fines  271990   662007 reserved division 2  water restrictions violations application this division shall apply to the violation of any restriction on the use of water or violations of section 1186 collectively referred to as water restrictions  422008 authorized agent shall mean any authorized agent or employee of the city who has been assigned the duty of code compliance by the city manager or city commission a broward county sheriffs officer or deputy shall be considered a code inspector  422008 appointed a code enforcement special master appointed by the city commission of the city of parkland shall have authority to hear alleged violations of water restrictions and impose the fines as authorized by city ordinance or as otherwise authorized by applicable law upon a finding of a violation of any water restriction  422008 authority shall have authority to cite persons in violation of water restrictions pursuant to the procedures set forth herein upon a determination that a violation of a water restriction exists the code inspector shall provide a notice to the person violating the water restriction the city hereby declares that any violation of a water restriction shall be the joint and severable responsibility of the person directly responsible for the water restriction violation and if different the owner of the property upon which the violation occurs all notices provided herein shall be by one of the following methods 1 certified mail return receipt requested to the owner of the property as listed in the tax collectors offices for tax notices  or 2 hand delivery by a law enforcement officer or code inspector  or 3 leaving the notice at the location where the violation occurred with any person above fifteen 15 years of age residing at the location provided the person is informed of the contents of the notice  or 4 where certified mail return receipt method is used as set forth above in subsection 1 and said notice is returned as unclaimed or refused notice may be served by publication or posting as follows a the notice shall be published once during each week for four 4 consecutive weeks in a newspaper of general circulation in broward county  or b in lieu of publication as set forth above the notice may be posted at least fourteen days prior to any hearing to be held on the violation in at least two 2 locations one of which shall be on the property upon which the violation is alleged to exist and the other which shall be at city hall for a posted notice there shall be a proof of posting by affidavit by the person posting the notice which affidavit shall include a copy of the notice posted and the date and places of its posting 5 in a case of commercial premises leaving the notice with the manager or other person in charge  422008 violation notices all violation notices shall state the nature of the violation the date it occurred and shall provide the date time and location of a hearing before the special master at which the special master shall make a determination as to whether a violation exists the notice shall also state that the respondent shall have the right at the hearing to provide all defenses and relevant evidence related to the charge  422008 hearings all hearings shall be scheduled by the code enforcement inspector in conjunction with the special master each case before the special master related to water restrictions shall be presented by the code inspector or an attorney selected by the city for the purposes of presenting the case if the city prevails in prosecuting a case before the special master it shall be entitled to recover all costs incurred in prosecuting the case such costs may be included in the lien provided pursuant to the procedures set forth herein  422008 testimony a special master shall hear the cases set on the agenda for the particular date all testimony shall be under oath and shall be recorded by electronic device or stenographer the special master shall take testimony from the code inspector the alleged violator and any persons they deem to possess relevant evidence the formal rules of evidence shall not apply but fundamental due process shall be observed and shall govern the proceedings at the conclusion of the hearing the special master shall make a determination as to whether a violation exists and if so the amount of the fine the findings shall be reduced to a written order if the fine is not paid within ninety 90 days of the written order the city may record a copy of the order in the public records the recordation of which shall constitute a lien on the respondents property the city may attach an affidavit to the order as part of a notice of code lien which shall include the amount of costs incurred in the prosecution including overtime costs together with the amount of the fine  the notice of code lien shall include the costs as set forth in the affidavit  422008 secs 1110411110  reserved article x  newsracks footnotes  9  editors
