definitions for the purposes of this article the words below shall have the following meanings designated area shall mean those areas depicted on exhibit a of  for location of newsracks distributor shall mean the person individual partnership corporation association firm company organization or any other legal entity owning or responsible for placing or maintaining a newsrack in a public rightofway newsrack shall mean any selfservice or coinoperated box container storage unit or other dispenser installed used or maintained for the display sale or distribution of audio visual written or printed material including but not limited to magazines newspapers news periodicals advertising circulars books pictures photographs records and videos newsrack location shall mean an area where newsracks are located containing from one 1 to eight 8 newsracks operator shall mean the entity or person who places reading material in the newsrack the owner of the reading material placed in the newsrack or the entity or person with custody or control of the newsrack owner shall mean the entity or person that owns the newsrack or has a leasehold interest in the newsrack or a license to use the newsrack parkway shall mean any area within a rightofway which is not a pathway or roadway pathway shall mean any surface provided for the use of pedestrians and bicycles riders or any equestrian riders public property shall mean parks squares plazas and any and all other real property owned by the city recovery area shall mean that space as determined by state department of transportation regulations as promulgated in its green book which is measured from the edge of the roadway outward and which is required to be clear of fixed objects rightofway shall mean all that area which is dedicated to use by the public for pedestrian and vehicular travel and includes but is not limited to roadways parkways and pathways roadway shall mean that portion of a street improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel including a median undesignated area shall mean those areas not designated on exhibit a of   151994 placement standards no newsrack shall be located in the public rightofway or on public property 1 within five 5 feet of any marked crosswalk mailbox driveway or curbcut 2 within ten 10 feet of any fire hydrant fire call box or other emergency facility 3 within ten 10 feet ahead of and ten 10 feet in the rear of any trafficrelated sign 4 within that part of a fivefoot radius of the outer end of any bus bench between the bus bench and any roadway 5 at any location whereby the clear space for the passageway of pedestrians would be reduced to less than five 5 feet 6 within five 5 feet of or on any public property improved with landscaping measured from the edge of the flowers shrubs trees and other landscaping located on public property or rightsofway 7 within twenty 20 feet of any police station driveway fire station driveway ambulance station driveway entrance to hospital emergency room or other emergency facility 8 if there is within five hundred 500 feet on the same block another newsrack which regularly contains the same newspaper or periodical provided that the distance shall be one thousand 1000 feet from designated areas as used herein block shall mean one 1 side of a street between two 2 consecutive intersecting streets 9 on a roadway  151994 installation appearance and maintenance after  all newsracks erected maintained or operated within a public rightofway or other public property in the city shall conform to the following standards 1 no more than eight 8 newsracks shall be permitted at each newsrack location in the undesignated areas of the city each newsrack location will be selected by the first distributor to choose that location for their newsrack in order to provide fair access to all publications space assignment shall be made based solely on firstcome firstserved basis no two 2 groupings of newspapers shall be located within five hundred 500 feet of each other on the same side of any roadway  provided that in designated areas where newsracks have been erected no newsrack or grouping of same shall be located within one thousand 1000 feet of the newsracks located in such designated areas 2 no advertising shall be permitted upon newsracks other than that relating to information contained in the newspaper or periodical located in the newsrack advertisements for products for sale are prohibited 3 no newsrack shall exceed fiftyfour 54 inches in height thirtyeight 38 inches in width or twenty 20 inches in depth for single newsrack and seventysix 76 inches in width for doublewide newsrack triple newsracks are prohibited a maximum of one 1 double newsrack shall be permitted at each location 4 each newsrack shall be constructed installed and maintained in a safe and secure condition and shall be sufficiently weighted to avoid being vandalized or becoming a hazard in severe weather however no newsrack or group of newsracks shall weigh in the aggregate in excess of one hundred eighty 180 pounds when empty unless easily separable 5 each newsrack shall be maintained in a clean neat and attractive condition and in good repair at all times so that a it is reasonably free of dirt and grease b it is reasonably free of chipped faded peeling and cracked paint in the visible painted areas thereof c it is reasonably free of rust and corrosion in the visible unpainted metal areas thereon d the clear plastic or glass parts thereof if any the publications therein are viewed are unbroken and reasonably free of cracks dents blemishes and discoloration e the paper or cardboard parts or inserts thereof are reasonably free of tears peeling or fading f the structural parts thereof are not broken or unduly misshapen 6 no newsrack may be chained bolted or affixed to public property  151994 identification  registration a each newsrack shall have affixed to it in a readily visible place the phone number of a working telephone service to call to report a malfunction or to secure a refund in the event of a malfunction of the coinreturn mechanism and shall also provide the name and address of the distributor to receive the notices provided for in this article b although no permit or license is required prior to the placement of newsracks any person who places or maintains such a newsrack must provide a written notice with the city manager or his designee of the location or of change in location within three 3 days of its placement or relocation that notice will establish a space assignment within the provisions of this article written notice to the city must contain the name address and phone number of the owner operator and distributor the date it was first located on the rightofway and the location thereof with sufficient specificity to permit the city to locate the newsrack and inspect same the notice may be in the form of a list which may be updated  new locations shall be underlined on each updated list failure to provide this notice or to keep the list current and accurate shall be a violation of this article c to defray administrative costs the owner operator or distributor shall pay a onetime compliance fee of ten dollars $1000 for each newsrack installed the fee shall be paid within thirty 30 days after  for existing newsracks and ten 10 days after placement of a newsrack in the public rightofway thereafter  151994 insurance the owner operator or distributor shall procure and keep in force liability insurance in a minimum amount of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 per person and two hundred thousand dollars $20000000 per incident for all newsracks located on city rightsofway or property the insurance shall name the city as a named insured and provide that the city shall receive thirty 30 days notice of any cancellation the insurance shall be provided within thirty 30 days after  for existing newsracks and within ten 10 days after location of a newsrack in the rightofway  151994 abandonment no newsrack shall remain empty for a period of fifteen 15 consecutive days in the event a newsrack remains empty for that period it shall be deemed abandoned and may be removed as set forth in subsection 11117d for the purposes of this section a newsrack will be declared empty under the following circumstances 1 when it is without any contents  or 2 when the newsrack contains material bearing a date or other conspicuous evidence which dates it fortyfive 45 days prior to the date it is inspected  151994 enforcement a the owner distributor and or operator of the newsrack shall be responsible for compliance with all provisions of this article b upon determination by the city manager or his designee that a newsrack has been installed used or maintained in violation of the provisions of this article an order to correct the offending conditions shall be issued to the owner operator or distributor of the newsrack such order shall be handdelivered or mailed by certified mail return receipt requested to the address required by subsection 11114a above and posted on the offending newsrack the order shall specifically describe the offending condition and advise of the enforcement provisions contained therein if no address has been provided the sole notice shall be provided by posting c failure to promptly correct the offending condition within ten 10 days after receipt of the order except that if notice of receipt at the listed address is not received within twenty 20 days then sufficient notice shall be deemed to have been given shall be a violation of this article subject to a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 for each day the violation exists the fine will begin accruing on the eleventh day after the receipt of this order or upon the twentyfirst day of service as provided above violations shall be prosecuted of a notice to appear and prosecution in the county court or as set forth in subsection d each day the offense continues shall be a separate violation of this article except that if the offending owner operator or distributor pleads not guilty at the arraignment the fine shall be considered to be stayed after the first day and shall not continue to accrue until a final adjudication of the matter including all appeals after the matter is adjudicated and all appeals concluded continuance of the same violation shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 per day and no stay shall be granted by virtue of a not guilty plea when the owner operator or distributor of the offending newsrack is not known or identified and the city has made diligent search and inquiry in order to locate the owner operator or distributor a copy of the order shall be posted on the newsrack and this shall be deemed sufficient notice of the order to comply and the fine shall begin accruing on the tenth day after posting d if the offending newsrack has been posted pursuant to subsections b as a result of the failure of the owner operator or distributor to provide its address as required herein or the owner operator or distributor refuses to accept a notice to appear and the newsrack remains in violation of this article or if the newsrack is deemed abandoned as set forth in section 11116 for fifteen 15 days the city may remove same and hold it in storage for sixty 60 days thereafter it may be disposed of as the city deems appropriate the city shall return news racks held in storage during this period upon satisfactory proof of ownership and payment of a storage charge of three dollars $300 per day of storage e in addition to the procedures set forth the city shall enforce the provisions of this article by all other lawful means including but not limited to seeking injunctive relief  151994 article xi  alcoholic beverages in commercial establishments definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning advertisement means a display notice or other information designed to attract public attention including but not limited to handbills signs billboards soundtracks placards signboards and written notices alcoholic beverages means all beverages containing more than onehalf 12 of one 1 percent of alcohol by weight including beer and wine areola means the darkened ring surrounding the nipple of a female breast commercial means operated for pecuniary gain which shall be presumed for any establishment which imposes a charge for entrance to view entertainment or to remain on the premises or to obtain any goods items food drink or service for purposes of this article operating for pecuniary gain shall not depend on actual profit or loss establishment means a physical plant or location or the commercial activities or operations being conducted or both together as the context of this article may require nude or seminude entertainment means any activity where specified anatomical areas are exposed or displayed in public view or where specified anatomical activities are displayed or performed in public view  this shall include the display of motion pictures which permit the audience to view such areas or activities premises means a physical plant or location which is enclosed by walls or any other enclosing structural device or which is covered by a single roof or with a single shared entrance from outside specified anatomical areas is defined as 1 less than completely and opaquely covered a human genitals and pubic region  or b cleavage of the human buttocks  or c that portion of the human female breast encompassed within an area falling below the horizontal line one would have to draw to intersect a point immediately above the top of the areola including the areola  this definition shall include the entire lower portion of the human female breast but shall not include a portion of the cleavage of the human female breast exhibited by a dress blouse skirt leotard bathing suit or other wearing apparel provided the areola is not so exposed  and 2 human male genitals in a discernibly turgid state even if completely and opaquely covered specified sexual activities is defined as 1 human genitals in a state of sexual stimulation arousal or tumescence  or 2 acts of human anilingus bestiality buggery cunnilingus coprophagy coprophilia fellatio flagellation masochism masturbation necrophilia pederasty pedophilia sadism sadomasochism sexual intercourse or sodomy  or 3 fondling or other touching of human genitals pubic region buttock anus or female breast  or 4 excretory functions as part of or in connection with the activities set forth in subsections 1 3  10192005   1172007 prohibitions a it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in nude or seminude entertainment in any commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are or are available to be sold dispensed consumed possessed or offered for sale or consumption on the premises b it shall be unlawful for any person while on the premises of a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are or are available to be sold dispensed consumed possessed or offered for sale or consumption on the premises to display or expose to public view specified anatomical areas or engage in specified sexual activities in public view c it shall be unlawful for any entertainer performer or employee while on the premises of a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are to be sold dispensed consumed or offered for sale or consumption on the premises to engage in specified sexual activities in public view d it shall be unlawful for any entertainer performer or employee while on the premises of a commercial establishment regulated under this article to sit upon or straddle the legs lap or body of any patron spectator or other person therein or to engage in or simulate sexual activity while touching or being touched by such patron spectator or other person e it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in specified sexual activity in public view or to permit the graphic representation of specified anatomical areas or specified sexual activity in public view on the premises of a commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are or are available to be sold dispensed consumed or offered for sale for consumption on the premises f it shall be unlawful for any person owning managing or operating any commercial establishment at which alcoholic beverages are or are available to be sold dispensed consumed possessed or offered for sale or consumption on the premises to knowingly suffer or permit any person on the premises to engage in any conduct prohibited in subsections a f  10192005   1172007 proof a it shall be prima facie evidence that a beverage is an alcoholic beverage if proof exists 1 the beverage in question was or is known as whiskey moonshine whiskey shine rum gin tequila vodka scotch scotch whiskey brandy beer malt liquor or by any other similar name or names  or 2 the beverage was contained in a bottle or can labeled as any of the above names or a name similar thereto and the bottle or can bears the manufacturers insignia name or trademark b any person who by experience in the handling of alcoholic beverages or who by taste smellor drinking of such alcoholic beverages has knowledge of the alcoholic nature thereof may testify as to his opinion about whether such beverage is an alcoholic beverage  10192005   1172007 penalties for violation of article any person who shall violate any provision of this footnotes  10  editors note  adopted dec 5 200 amended the former art xii  1113911142 and enacted a new art xii as set out herein formerly  adopted  set out provisions intended for use as  1139 for purposes of classification and to preserve the style of this at the citys instruction these provisions have been included as art xii  1113911142 it should be noted that exhibit a referenced in this article is not set out but is on file and available for inspection in the office of the city clerk findings and intent 1 repeat sexual offenders sexual offenders who use physical violence and sexual offenders who prey on children are sexual predators who present an extreme threat to the public safety sexual offenders are extremely likely to use physical violence and to repeat their offenses and most sexual offenders commit many offenses have many more victims than are ever reported and are prosecuted for only a fraction of their crimes this makes the cost of sexual offender victimization to society at large while incalculable clearly exorbitant 2 it is the intent of this section to serve the citys compelling interest to promote protect and improve the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city by creating areas around locations where children regularly congregate in concentrated numbers wherein certain sexual offenders and sexual predators are prohibited from establishing temporary or permanent residence  1252007 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning child means a person under the age of sixteen 16 years child care facility means day nurseries family day care homes licensed by the department of children and families permanent residence means a place where the person abides lodges or resides for fourteen 14 or more consecutive days park means a county or municipal park playground means an area set aside by a homeowners association of the city for use by minors to play or an area set aside by a governmental agency devoted to active recreational uses for the primary use of preschool or elementary school age children school means a public or private kindergarten elementary middle or secondary high school sexual offender or sexual predator shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in fs  77521 temporary residence means a place where the person abides lodges or resides for a period of fourteen 14 or more days in the aggregate during any calendar year and which is not the persons permanent address or a place where the person routinely abides lodges or resides for a period of four 4 or more consecutive or nonconsecutive days in any month and which is not the persons permanent residence  1252007   8182010 sexual offender and sexual predator residence prohibition  penalties  exceptions 1 minimum distance from school park day care center etc it is unlawful for any person who has been convicted of a violation of 04   or  florida statutes or a similar offense in another jurisdiction regardless of whether adjudication has been withheld in which the victim of the offense was less than sixteen 16 years of age to establish a permanent residence or temporary residence within two thousand five hundred 2500 feet of any school designated public school bus stop day care center park or playground persons convicted of a violation of florida statutes within the previous five 5 years shall be subject to the same restrictions 2 measurement of minimum distance for purposes of determining the minimum distance separation the requirement shall be measured by following a straight line from the outer property line of the permanent residence or temporary residence to nearest outer property line of a school designated public school bus stop day care center park or playground 3 penalties a person who violates this section shall be punished by a fine not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment for a term not exceeding sixty 60 days or by both such fine and imprisonment  for a second or subsequent conviction of a violation of this section such person shall be punished by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars $100000 or imprisonment in the county jail not more than twelve 12 months or by both such fine and imprisonment 4 exceptions a person residing within two thousand five hundred 2500 feet of any school designated public school bus stop day care center park playground or other place where children regularly congregate does not commit a violation of this section if any of the following apply i the sexual offender or sexual predator established the permanent residence prior to  ii the sexual offender or sexual predator was a minor when heshe committed the offense and was not convicted as an adult iii the sexual offender or sexual predator is a minor iv the school designated public school bus stop or day care center within two thousand five hundred 2500 feet of the sexual offender or sexual predators permanent residence was opened after the person established the permanent residence  1252007   2172010  1139c 8182010   142012 property owners prohibited from renting real property to certain sexual offenders and sexual predators  penalties 1 it is unlawful to let or rent any place structure or part thereof trailer or other conveyance with the knowledge that it will be used as a permanent residence or temporary residence by any person prohibited from establishing such permanent residence or temporary residence pursuant to this article if such place structure or part thereof trailer or other conveyance is located within two thousand five hundred 2500 feet of any school designated public school bus stop day care center park playground or other place where children regularly congregate 2 prior to letting renting or leasing any place structure or part thereof trailer or other conveyance for use as a permanent or temporary residence that is located within two thousand five hundred 2500 feet of a school designated public school bus stop day care center park playground or other place where children regularly congregate and annually thereafter if a rental agreement is entered into the owner or lessor shall obtain confirmation of a nationwide search from the broward sheriffs office parkland district or other law enforcement agency that the prospective renter lessee or adult resident is not a registered sexual offender or sexual predator as a result of a conviction of a sexual offense as defined herein 3 a property owners failure to comply with provisions of this section shall constitute a violation of this section and shall subject the property owner to all code enforcement provisions and procedures as permitted in the city 5 of the city in court or as otherwise permitted by law including but not limited to injunctive or other relief in a court of law in order to secure compliance with this article  1252007  1139d 8182010  1139d 11172010 sexual offender and sexual predator access to parks playgrounds and child care facilities restricted  penalties 1 it is unlawful for a sexual offender or sexual predator convicted of a sexual offense as defined in the section above to knowingly be present in a municipal park or a playground when a child under the age of sixteen 16 years is present unless the sexual offender or sexual predator is the parent or legal guardian of a child present in the park or playground prior to any citation for a violation under this section the alleged violator shall be given an opportunity to promptly leave the park or playground 2 it is unlawful for a sexual offender or sexual predator convicted of a sexual offense as defined herein above to knowingly enter or remain in a child care facility facility or on its premises unless the sexual offender or sexual predator a is dropping off or picking up a child registered at the facility and is the parent or guardian of said child  and b remains under the supervision of a facility supervisor or his or her designee while on the facility premises 1139e 8182010 loitering or prowling in child safety zone  penalties 1 it is unlawful for any sexual offender or sexual predator a to loiter or prowl with the intent to commit a sexual offense as listed herein above in this article  b while knowingly within five hundred 500 feet of a school school bus stop child care center or playground when children are present  and c to engage in overt conduct that under the circumstances manifests an intent to commit a sexual offense as listed herein above in this article 2 conduct which may under the circumstances be deemed adequate to manifest an intent to commit a sexual offense as listed herein above in this article but is not limited to conduct such as the following a making sexual conversation or sexual remarks to a child  b making lewd or sexual gestures to a child or exposing sexual organs to a child  c giving gifts of candy money music or other items to a child to which he or she is not related or acquainted 3 unless flight by the sexual offender or sexual predator or other circumstance makes it impracticable a law enforcement officer shall prior to any arrest for an offense under this section afford the sexual offender or sexual predator an opportunity to explain his or presence and conduct no sexual offender or sexual predator shall be convicted of an offense under this section if the law enforcement officer did not comply with this procedure or if it is proven at trial that the explanation given by the sexual offender or sexual predator is true and that the sexual offender or sexual predator had no intent to commit a sexual offense 4 as used in this section a sexual offender or sexual predator is related to a child if he or she is the father mother stepfather stepmother grandparent sibling cousin aunt uncle or resides with the child as used in this section a sexual offender or sexual predator is acquainted with a child if he or she has been introduced to the child in the presence of an adult with legal authority to supervise the child this provision is not intended to limit or affect the applicability of any general loitering and prowling statutes to sexual offenders or sexual predators including but not limited to fs   1139f 8182010 secs 1114511170  reserved article xiii  advertising of vehicles boats and other similar items for sale along city rightsofway public rightofway easement it shall be unlawful for any person to place on the public rightofway which shall include ingress and egress easements dedicated to the public any motor vehicle any boat any trailer or any personal watercraft with any signage or other communicative material indicating that it is for sale rent or otherwise available for use by someone other than the owner it shall also be a violation for any person to permit to be placed on his or her property any motor vehicle any boat any trailer or any personal watercraft with any signage or other communicative material indicating that it is for sale rent or otherwise available for use by someone other than the owner except where said vehicle is lawfully parked on a paved or other hard surface private driveway or within an enclosed structure  9212005 violation no motor vehicles boats trailers or personal watercraft shall be permitted to remain on the rightofway for a period of twentyfour 24 consecutive hours any motor vehicle boat trailer or personal watercraft violating this requirement shall be towed by the city after a twentyfourhour notice containing notice that the motor vehicle boat trailer or personal watercraft will be towed if not removed in twentyfour 24 hours and containing the necessary retrieval information which shall be affixed to the motor vehicle boat trailer or personal watercraft the owner of the motor vehicle boat trailer or personal watercraft shall be responsible for retrieving same and the costs thereof  9212005 peddlers and solicitors footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  licenses ch 10 state law reference peddlers at camp meetings fs  87103  solicitation of funds fs ch 496 article i  in general definitions canvasser or solicitor shall mean any individual whether resident of the city or not traveling either by foot automobile motor truck or any other type of conveyance from place to place from house to house or from street to street taking or attempting to take orders for sale of goods wares merchandise personal property or services of any nature whatsoever whether or not such individual has carries or exposes for sale a sample of the subject of such sale or whether or not he is collecting advance payments on such sales such definition shall not include any person who 1 for himself or for another person firm or corporation hires leases uses or occupies any hotel or motel room within the city for the sole purpose of exhibiting samples within the hotel or motel taking orders for future delivery only 2 solicits or canvasses on behalf of a charitable organization 3 solicits or canvasses on behalf of a political party candidate or political viewpoint 4 solicits or canvasses on behalf of public or private schools raising funds for schools teaching grades kindergarten twelve 12 colleges and universities 5 solicits or canvasses on behalf of a religious institution charitable organization  as defined by fs   means a person who is or holds herself or himself out to be established for any benevolent educational philanthropic humane scientific artistic patriotic social welfare or advocacy public health environmental conservation civic or other eleemosynary purpose or a person who in any manner employs a charitable appeal as the basis for any solicitation or an appeal that suggests that there is a charitable purpose to any solicitation religious institution as defined by fs   means a church ecclesiastical or denominational organization or established physical place for worship in this state at which nonprofit religious services and activities are regularly conducted and carried on and includes those bona fide religious groups that do not maintain specific places of worship the term also includes a separate group or corporation that forms an integral part of a religious institution that is exempt from federal income tax under c3 of the internal revenue that is not primarily supported by funds solicited outside its own membership or congregation  551982   3152017 organizationsexemptions a organizations claiming exempt status under section 121 shall provide the city with a copy of the registration statement required pursuant to fs   b soliciting or canvassing by persons on behalf of a charitable organization on behalf of a political party political candidate or political viewpoint or on behalf of a religious institution shall not take place before  am or onehalf hour after sunset  551982   3152017  purpose and intent a the city commission of the city of parkland wishes to protect the privacy of residents who do not desire doortodoor solicitation or canvassing as well as the privacy of those residents who wish to receive doortodoor solicitation or canvassing only during certain desired hours in addition the city commission wishes to protect and further the rights of residents who may want to receive doortodoor solicitation or canvassing at all times the city commission is no less cognizant of the first amendment protections afforded to doortodoor soliciting and canvassing and the concomitant duty of the elected officials to safeguard and protect such first amendment rights b it is the purpose and intent of the city commission to balance and weigh these sometimes competing concerns in creating this section so as to enact narrowly tailored content and viewpoint neutral regulation which satisfies the citys recognized and significant governmental interests in safeguarding resident privacy by using what is perceived to be very restrictive and minimally intrusive regulatory means in view of the equal adverse impact commercial and noncommercial doortodoor soliciting and canvassing have on resident privacy all while providing for ample alternative avenues for communication  3152017 editors note of adopted mar 15 201 amended  123 in its entirety to read as herein set out former  123 pertained to other exemptions and derived from adopted  uninvited solicitation and canvassing a this section will not operate to totally ban doortodoor soliciting and canvassing but will permit the residents to protect themselves from solicitors or canvassers by posting no solicitation signs upon their property when doortodoor solicitation or canvassing is not desired all while leaving unaffected the ability of doortodoor solicitors and canvassers to contact residents desiring same and while leaving unaffected other methods of solicitation or canvassing direct mail solicitation or canvassing telephone solicitation or canvassing soliciting or canvassing in areas other than residential areas etc b solicitor or canvasser as used in this section means all persons seeking funds or services of any kind for any purpose or seeking to sell give or in any way dispose of goods services wares merchandise newspapers or written material of any kind regardless of whether the person is engaged in a commercial transaction or in a religious educational political scientific philanthropic benevolent fraternal charitable or any other noncommercial activity c no solicitor or canvasser shall willfully enter upon the property of a private residence when the owner or occupant thereof has posted or placed near or at the entrance of the property a sign containing the words no solicitation or a substantially similar message in letters easily read by a person approaching the property said signs shall be posted or placed in a manner and in such position as to be clearly noticeable to a person approaching the property d the provisions of this section shall not apply to any person or business representative invited upon the property by an inhabitant of the property or by an inhabitants agent or to the distribution of advertising materials us postal services or to the distribution of any newspaper of general circulation  3152017 secs 1251214  reserved article ii  permit required it shall be unlawful for any solicitor or canvasser as defined in section 121 of this chapter to engage in such business within the residentially zoned districts of the city without first obtaining a permit in compliance with the provisions of this chapter  551982 application a at the time of filing the application a fee of thirtyfive dollars $3500 shall be paid to the public safety department to cover the cost of investigation of the facts stated therein which fee shall be nonrefundable b applicants for permit under this chapter must file with the public safety department a sworn application in writing in duplicate on a form to be furnished by the city c each applicant shall submit the following information 1 name and description of applicant  date of birth social security number and drivers license number 2 permanent home address and full local address of the applicant 3 a brief description of the nature of the business and the goods to be sold or the service to be rendered 4 if employed the name and address of the employer together with credentials establishing the exact relationship 5 the length of time between  am and onehalf hour after sunset for which the right to do business is desired 6 the place where the goods or property proposed to be sold or orders taken for the sale thereof are manufactured or produced where such goods or products are located at the time the application is filed and the proposed method of delivery 7 the names of at least two 2 reliable property owners of the county who will certify as to the applicants good character and business responsibility or in lieu of references other available evidence as to the good character and business responsibility of the applicant which will enable the city to evaluate the character and business responsibility of the applicant 8 a sworn statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of any crime misdemeanor or violation of any municipal ordinance  if so the nature of the offense and the punishment or penalty assessed therefor d there shall be no soliciting before  am or onehalf hour after sunset  551982   3152017 investigation a upon receipt of each application the original shall be referred to the public safety director who shall cause an investigation to be made into the applicants character and business responsibility b if as a result of such investigation the applicants character or business responsibility is found to be unsatisfactory the public safety director shall so endorse the application stating the basis for same c the public safety director shall then notify the applicant that his application has been disapproved and that no permit shall be issued d if as a result of such investigation the character and business responsibility of the applicant are found to be satisfactory the public safety director shall so endorse the application e the public safety director shall then 1 cause to be taken by the public safety department a fingerprint and photograph of the applicant 2 upon payment of the prescribed permit fee deliver to the applicant his permit and issue an identification card 3 such permit shall contain the signature and seal of the issuing officer and shall show a the name and address of the applicant  b the amount of fee paid  c the date of issuance  d the length of time the same shall be operative  e the name of the company the applicant represents if any as well as  f the license permit number 4 keep permanent records of all permits and identification cards issued  551982   3152017 fees the permit fee per solicitor or canvasser shall be collected by the public safety director and the charge for such permit shall be thirtyfive dollars $3500 per year  551982 secs 12191229  reserved article iii  identification card required the public safety department shall issue to each applicant at the time of delivery of his permit an identification card which shall contain the words licensed solicitor and indicate 1 the name and address of the solicitor or canvasser  2 the name of the company he represents  3 the length of time his permit is valid and the time of day permitted to solicit or canvass  4 the kind of goods or services to be sold thereunder and contain the applicants fingerprint and citysealed photograph  551982 exhibition of identification card solicitors and canvassers are required to exhibit their identification card upon their person at all times when soliciting andor canvassing under the terms of this chapter  551982 records the public safety department shall maintain a record of all violations of this chapter and shall maintain a record for each permit identification card and record the reports of convictions therein  551982 secs 12331243  reserved article iv  revocation and appeal revocation of permits and identification cards a permits and identification cards issued under the provisions of this chapter may be revoked by the public safety director of the city after notice and public hearing for any of the following causes 1 fraud misrepresentation or false statement contained in the application for permit or identification card  2 fraud misrepresentation or false statement made in the course of carrying on his business as a solicitor or as a canvasser  3 conviction of any violation of this chapter  4 conviction of any crime or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude  or 5 conducting the business of soliciting or of canvassing in an unlawful manner or in such a manner as to constitute a breach of the peace or to constitute a menace to the health safety or general welfare of the public b notice of the hearing for revocation of a permit or identification card shall be given by the city in writing setting forth specifically the ground of complaint and the time and place of hearing such notice shall be mailed postage prepaid to the permit or identification card holder at his lastknown address at least five 5 days prior to the date set for hearing notice of the public hearing shall also be posted at the city hall at least five 5 days prior to the public hearing  551982 appeal a any person aggrieved by the action of the city in the denial or revocation of a permit or identification card shall have the right to appeal to the city commission of the city b such appeal shall be taken by filing with the commission within fourteen 14 days after notice of the action complained of has been mailed to such persons lastknown address a written statement setting forth fully the grounds for appeal c the city commission shall set a time and place for a hearing on such appeal and notice of such hearing shall be given to the applicant in the same manner as provided in subsection 1244b of this chapter for notice of hearing on revocation d the decision and order of the city commission on such appeal shall be final and conclusive  551982 expiration of permit and identification cards a all annual permits and identification cards issued under the provisions of this chapter shall expire on september 30 of each year b other than annual permits identification cards shall expire on the date specified in the permit  551982 enforcement the public safety department shall have the authority to inspect all moving vehicles operating on the streets and public places of the city as well as any person seen or known to be soliciting or canvassing to determine whether the solicitor or canvasser has complied with the provisions of this chapter article i  in general assessment and collection of fees for police training a there is hereby assessed by the city in compliance with fs  943258 two dollars $200 as court costs against every person convicted for violation of a state penal or criminal statute or convicted of a municipal or county ordinance where the offense occurred within the city b in addition two dollars $200 shall be deducted from every bond estreature or forfeited bail bond related to such penal statutes or ordinances c however no such assessment shall be made against any person convicted for violation of any state statute municipal or county ordinance relating to the parking of vehicles d all such assessments shall be collected by the appropriate court and shall be remitted to the city and earmarked for law enforcement education and training for members of the police department e the use and expenditure of such funds shall be in accordance with education and training programs for law enforcement personnel as determined by the chief of police and in accordance with fs  94314  11171976  a  1 161982 state law reference assessment of county court costs for training fs  94325 key boxes a in all new and existing developments there shall be installed a key box at the developments expense when the citys fire andor police chief determines that access to or within a structure or an area is unduly difficult because of secured openings or where immediate access is necessary for lifesafety or firefighting purposes the key box shall be a type approved by the citys fire and police chiefs and shall contain 1 keys to locked points of ingress whether on the interior or exterior of such buildings  2 keys to locked mechanical equipment rooms  3 keys to locked electrical rooms  4 keys to other places as directed by the citys fire andor police chiefs b if at any time the key stored in the lock box changes then the development is to notify the fire department and supply new keys to the citys fire and police chiefs within twentyfour 24 hours of the lock box change the fire and police chiefs shall approve the location of the lock boxes c existing developments shall have six 6 months from the date of adoption of this section to conform as required d any entity or person who violates any provision of this section or fails to comply therewith shall upon conviction thereof be subject to a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 and each day said violation shall exist or be permitted to exist shall constitute a separate offense  1112006 community automated external defibrillator aed and bleeding control kit program 1 definition of automated external defibrillators automated external defibrillator device a defibrillator device that a is commercially distributed in accordance with the federal food drug and cosmetic act  b is capable of recognizing the presence or absence of ventricular fibrillation and is capable of determining without intervention by the user of the device whether defibrillation should be performed  and c upon determining that defibrillation should be performed is able to deliver an electrical shock to an individual 2 definition of bleeding control kit bck a collection of equipment housed in a container that displays the universal medical symbol that is used to attempt to control bleeding from a patient who has suffered a traumatic injury a bleeding control kit shall contain the following equipment that must be approved by the fire department prior to purchase regular bck a two 2 commercially manufactured tourniquets  b two 2 fourinch pressure dressings  c two 2 compressed gauze pads  d two 2 vented chest seals  e two 2 pairs of xlarge medical gloves  f one 1 pair of trauma scissors  and g one 1 instruction card large bck a eight 8 commercially manufactured tourniquets  b eight 8 fourinch pressure dressings  c eight 8 compressed gauze pads  d eight 8 vented chest seals  e eight 8 pairs of xlarge medical gloves  f one 1 pair of trauma scissors  and g one 1 instruction card 3 intent a it is the intent of the city and the purpose of this chapter 1 to promote the public health safety and general welfare by requiring the installation of automated external defibrillator devices and bleeding control kits within certain buildings in the city  2 to provide for the inspection of each automated external defibrillator device and bleeding control kit within the city  3 to provide for the payment of automated external defibrillator and bleeding control kit inspection fees  and 4 to provide for penalties for noncompliance with this article 4 automated external defibrillator devices and bleeding control kits required a automated external defibrillator devices and regular bleeding control kits unless otherwise specified shall be installed in the following locations and buildings located within the geographical boundaries of the city 1 gymnasiums fitness centers and indoor recreational centers in excess of one thousand five hundred 1500 square feet  2 restaurants theaters and dining establishments with a one hundred 100 maximum capacity or greater including indoor outdoor and bar area  3 all hotels and motels  4 assisted living facilities as defined by fs  42902 as amended from time to time  5 pharmacies a pharmacy is an establishment or institution in which the practice of pharmacy is conducted  drugs medicines or medicinal chemicals are dispensed or offered for sale or a sign is displayed bearing the word or words pharmacist pharmacy apothecary drugstore druggist medicine store drug sundries prescriptions filled or similar words intended to indicate that the practice of pharmacy is being conducted  6 all dental offices in accordance with florida administrative   7 multistory occupancies listed in subsections 1 or multistory office buildings shall place an aed on every other floor beginning on the first floor the aed shall be placed near the elevators beginning in the first floor lobby first floor third floor etc 8 office buildings with a square footage greater than twenty thousand 20000 square feet  9 commercial and retail spaces with a square footage greater than thirtyfive thousand 35000 square feet  10 places of occupancy that hold five hundred 500 or more persons shall have a large bleeding control kit in addition to the required automated external defibrillators 5 installation and operation a the city shall inspect all automated external defibrillator and bleeding control kits for operation prior to being placed in service or available for use and on an annual basis b automated external defibrillator devices shall be 1 conspicuously located in plain view of the primary public entrance with unobstructed access  2 housed in a cabinet with a clear window in the door an audible alarm signaling the opening of a door permanently affixed to a wall and whose top is no more than fortyeight 48 inches above the floor  3 located below a sign having a minimum area of seventy 70 square inches and containing the letters aed and the universally recognizable symbol which shall be placed no more than sixty 60 inches on center above the floor  4 readily accessible and immediately available when needed for onsite employees and the general public including disabled persons  and 5 placed near the elevators in the first floor lobby if the building contains an elevator c automated external defibrillator devices shall contain adult and pediatric pads and bandage scissors adult living facilities shall be exempt from providing pediatric pads d all automated external defibrillator devices shall be used in accordance with the manufacturers guidelines e bleeding control kits shall be located in the same cabinet as automated external defibrillators or 1 conspicuously located in plain view of the primary public entrance with unobstructed access  2 housed in a cabinet with a clear window in the door an audible alarm signaling the opening of a door permanently affixed to a wall and whose top is no more than fortyeight 48 inches above the floor or housed in the automated defibrillator cabinet  3 located below a sign having a minimum area of seventy 70 square inches and containing the words bleeding control and the universally recognizable medical cross which shall be placed no more than sixty 60 inches on center above the floor  4 readily accessible and immediately available when needed for onsite employees and the general public including disabled persons  and 5 placed near the elevators in the first floor lobby if the building contains an elevator f it shall be the responsibility of the owner of the building to 1 install automated external defibrillator devices  2 provide all necessary training as approved by the fire department or as set forth in the manufacturer specifications for appropriate use 3 maintain automated external defibrillator devices and bleeding control kits in accordance with manufacturers recommended maintenance requirements and as required herein 4 comply with all other provisions of this section g if an automated external defibrillator device or bleeding control kit or any part thereof is removed for repair a replacement shall be provided within fortyeight 48 hours h if an automated external defibrillator device or bleeding control kit is required to be located within a business signage containing the letters aed and the universally recognizable symbol is required to be placed within the tenant message space on the door and shall be displayed on all external doors of all buildings in which an aed is required 6 fees fees for automated external defibrillator device permits and inspections shall be set by resolution 7 penalties it shall constitute a violation of the city punishable as provided in this sectionto intentionally or willfully a render an automated external defibrillator device or bleeding control kit inoperative except during such time as the automated external defibrillator device is being serviced tested repaired or recharged except pursuant to court order  b obliterate the serial number on an automated external defibrillator device or bleeding control kit for purposes of falsifying service records  c improperly service recharge repair test or inspect an automated external defibrillator device bleeding control kit  d use the inspection certificate of another person  e hold an inspection certificate and allow another person to use said inspection certificate number  f intentionally open an encased automated external defibrillator or bleeding control kit for any purpose other than to provide emergency medical care it shall not be a violation of this subsection for an owner of property or an agent thereof to open their encased automated external defibrillator or bleeding control kit for maintenance replacement or inspection  or g to otherwise fail to comply with this article 8 penalties failure to comply with any part of this article shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding sixty 60 days or by both fine and imprisonment each day a violation exists shall be a separate violation in addition the city shall also have the right to revoke refuse to issue refuse to reissue refuse to transfer or refuse to renew any business tax receipt for any facility business entity or establishment where the violation occurred until such time as the violation andor fine is corrected 9 requirements and procedures the following shall be the requirements and procedures for use and training of the aed program a the use and training of an aed shall occur only after a written notification in a form determined by the city is made to the fire chief or hisher designee by the individual entity organization or company acquiring an aed the written notification must contain the facility or business name street address specific location of the aed the number of employees at the facility or business the name of the aed manufacturer and model number of each aed b maintenance and inspection of the aed or bleeding control kit is the responsibility of the occupant and shall be done on a periodic basis at a minimum annually as prescribed by the manufacturer andor certifying agency maintenance of the aed device and bleeding control kit shall be in accordance with the manufacturers recommendations c the fire rescue department or hisher designee shall verify at a minimum annually the presence of the aed device and may inspect any maintenance records and documentation of training to ensure compliance with the community automated external defibrillator program d the city of parkland and the city of parkland fire rescue pursuant to a contract with the broward county sheriffs office in conjunction with the broward county sheriffs office the city manager shall determine the manner in which services shall be coordinated
